summary: A coming-of-age story based on the lives of street rappers in Mumbai.

reviews.review_title: It's not about a one person,it's about many,who struggles in their own.
reviews.content: It's not about only a rap,it's about every person who struggles their own inside.its the story about every struggling person who trapped under the bloody society.who want to fly,who want to go outside,who want do something.its not a rap movie,it's truly a inspirational movie.

Gully Boy merges into you and makes you feel as a part of Murad's journey (Ranveer Singh).
Dharavi 17 is where he stays and his daily struggles,his exposure to rap, his love life, a mistake in relationship,his guide,his well-wisher,his bonding with parents..
A common man's journey actually.
We all have such stories in our life.
Zoya has brilliantly captured the gully life here and shows how it moulds oneself with the amount of time you spend with people around you.With every movie this guy gets better.So once again Ranveer does his one of career's best.
Alia is the show stealer with dialogues that gets the whistle. We have three supporting Vijays here in this movie Vijay Raaz(father),Vijay Maurya(Uncle),Vijay Varma(Friend) and they are spot on.
Amruta Subash(mother) expresses her life's melancholy brilliantly.Kalki as sky gets limited screen time but packs a punch and last but not the least
the game changer Siddhant Chaturvedi(MC Sher). He overpowers Ranveer in many scenes.I won't stop if I start mentioning how apt and brilliant is the screenplay here..
Cinematography by Jay Oza and crisp editing by Nitin Baid are felt on the screen as the movie even being slow in pace doesn't be a boring affair in 2 hrs 35 mins.
Zoya has struck a win win here.Finally, what made it more lively was screen time for real life rappers like Emiway Bantaai,Stony Psycho and Dope Daddy from Dopedealicz , Kaambhaari and also a second of Brodha V.Just felt like saying this that how well the hip hop culture has been able to connect with our generation. Emiway Bantaai's one second presence in first half and the crowd erupted like never seen before. Also , his acts in second half are treat to watch. Not to forget Kaam Bhaari is there too.All in all 9/10 from my side.
Go for it folks.
Watch it for a beautiful journey of the guy from streets.

reviews.review_title: The Hate U Give to Youth ...
reviews.content: Gully Boy - A+ (Award Worthy)After listening to massive wave of backlash against Alia Bhatt and Gully Boy from Kangana Ranaut after untimely death of Sushant Singh Rajput (May he rest in peace). I decided to watch Gully Boy out of curiosity and I was amazed how terribly wrong Kangana was to attribute someone's death to a movie or certain people. Gully Boy for a person like me who rarely watch Bollywood movies unless it's on Netflix is such a game changer. A whole movie not only on rap music woven into struggles of a poor guys from slums with the message of empowerment to youth, friendships and dream was astounding.I don't even listen to rap music besides EMINEM, and I was enchanted by Indian rap which I have never heard in my life. I was amazed that they used no profanity laced rap in the movie to make it more appealing to younger crowed either. They showed Muslim background where singing in the family is the forbidden and empowered even Hijab wearing Alia Bhatt to speak her mind and still be the leading lady. To say she won award for 15 mints screen time is utterly ridiculous, you don't have to win an award for how much time you have spend on screen. Anthony Hopkins in Silence of the Lambs and Judi Dench in Elizabeth won Oscars for merely roles 10-15mints screen time. A movie like Gully Boy, which is one of kind real musical directed by a women is commendable.The hate towards the movie from some part of the very vocal group speaks volume of misogyny in some individuals. who want to take advantage of someone's demise to settle their own old scores against old enemies from YashRaj, Karan Johar, Bhatt Family, Hrithik's family friends Javed Akhtar etc etc. is utterly shameful. A person who never worked with him or helped him while he was being trolled for Drive and rumours now is trying to become his ally. Nepotism exists in every industry even a shopkeeper hands over businesses to his family not stranger and to train them you have to put them through the business. Some get successful, but mostly miserably fail. Legendary actors like Shahrukh Khan, Madhuri Dixit, Juhi Chawla, Akshay Kumar, Vidya Balan were outsiders, there is mix balance of both sides and new crop Ayushman Khurrana, Kangana Ranaut, Taapsee Panu, Rajkumar Rao, Katrina Kaif, Kriti Sanon and Bhumi Padnekar are proof that if you have talent you can make space, it won't be easy but if you want an easy life then don't chase your dreams. Chasing dreams and accomplishing them is going to be hard and I am glad that this movie shows that and put a light on such topic and I hope people understand and focus on positivity and not the negativity.A powerful movie which showed camaraderie among friends without jealousy, determination, family love and struggles living in slums with rap music is unimaginable in Bollywood mainstream cinema with top actors Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt. The movie deserves all accolades as cinema like this needs to be encouraged and appreciated.

Zoya changes gear with Gully Boy. It's the story of Murad (Ranveer Singh), his aspiration, ambition, his family, his love Safeena (Alia Bhatt), his friendships and the path he takes to fulfil his dream. At the forefront, Gully Boy may seem like a movie about the underground rappers but actually, it is much more than that.The movie is mainly about human relations, connections, emotions and dynamics. There is no filmmaker better than Zoya Akhtar who can portray and handle human complexities in such a brilliant way. Gully Boy will surely be counted amongst her best work.Ranveer and Alia's chemistry is too cute to be true. They are like a house on fire...,Vijay Varma special mention - He is too good...as Moeen,, got a good depth to the character.If the writing of the movie and Zoya's direction is of the highest order, Ranveer Singh, Alia Bhatt, debutant Sidhant Chaturvedi and other actors compliment it with fabulous performances.Alia Bhatt, is the scene stealer. Every scene she appears in is a riot. She is endearing, to say the least. This is one of her best performances and her character is a crash course in women empowerment. I am sure everyone's gonna fall in love with her.On the downside though, the pacing takes a dip in the second half.Gully Boy is one of the best movies to come out of Indian cinema in recent times. Watch it for Ranveer Singh, Alia Bhatt's dazzling performances. And moreover, watch it for the master filmmaker Zoya Akhtar. Hats off to her. This one's a winner.

reviews.review_title: it's not a copy of 8 mile you morons
reviews.content: Almost every rap star came from hardships and poverty and that is what rap is, poetry of your life with awesome beats so what the hell were these morons expecting, a guy with no issues becoming a rap star - what was copied from 8 mile? i dare you to justify yourselves you stupid morons. Every part of the movie was awesome.

Based on the life of street rappers from Dharavi, the film deals with poverty and class differences in the society. The film shows the 21st century youth who know what they want and are unafraid to chase their dreams.The screenplay and the direction is fantastic. Most of the performances are good but I'm unsure about Ranveer Singh. He is good enough but not convincing. The music is good.The Indian film industry is maturing and it's a good thing.

reviews.review_title: Zoya akhtar best movie till date
reviews.content: This is a perfect collage of stories told in the best possible way by zoya akhtar, it is also ranveer singh best acting ever. every frame is a treat.

I like Indian movies a lot. If Mumbai and its rougher edges are featured, all the better. I don't like (American) rap music. As a general rule, I avoid "coming of age" movies. So watching this film was a dilemma for me. Not a bad movie, but the main character looked like a grown man in his 30's. Not a college kid coming up. His age lurked in the back/front of my mind in every scene he was in. So I looked him up. Yeah, he's around 34. For me, it spoiled the film. Now I guess I gotta check the spoiler box!

It's a total entertainer.. Its the first movie of its kind and it has nailed the concept.. The movie has everything from comedy to a genuine focus on the routine lives and challenges of the people who get up everyday to make both ends meet.. Ranveer was superb and Alia has been awesome in the role of a confident and crazy girl.. Kalki's performance as usual is flawless and Siddhanth Chaturvedi, inspite of the film being his debut, didn't seem any less than his fellow experienced actors..

Acting-great performances very grounded in reality,Ranveer and Alia were great,the supporting cast was great and believable
Plot-Enjoyable plot with great dialogues,I myself am not into the latest music scene but you can understand clearly the way struggle is potrayed.For me the love story was an addition not a necessity if you watch Gully boy again sometime youll notice you can skip all the parts and the entire subplot between Ranveer and Alia and even the little fight where Alia knocks out Kalki you will notice the rest of the movie is still a good movie and it will be a different experience.
Screenplay-Heres a dilemna the screen play was very unique because heres how the movie progressed 5 min-character is having a blast,enjoying next 5 min-character is knocked out by a bad situation and is rethinking his entire life then repeat happy-sad-happy-sad-happy-sad......
Now I dont know if I would enjoy the movie more or less if the screen play was any different because at some moments I enjoyed it immensely but at some points I felt is this back and front swinging necessary cant you just go linearly like a normal person where you have first 30 minutes of sad and then next 30
minutes or hour of happy and right before interval 10 minutes of sad and so on.
The ending montage was great it gives you a good feeling but still some anbiguity, because he has achieved something of value,we dont know if he will continue to grow in his career,get to marry Safeena once she becomes a doctor,will his music remain popular and continue to inspire,will his father reconcile with them,etc.
Technically the movie was brilliant no doubt the sets,locations,costumes,camera work,music in songs ,background music,sound quality,lighting,colors,etc all were great

reviews.review_title: To all the reviewers who are saying Gully Boy is copied from 8 mile
reviews.content: NO ITS NOT COPIED FROM 8 MILE. Did you guys watch 8 mile and Gully Boy both?if you do think they are the same, then you need learn how to watch movies before you compare them. You also need to understand what a movie genre means. May be search in google to get better understanding.you all are saying 8 mile and Gully Boy are the same based on just few things as both movies are about rappers and their struggles. its like calling all the love stories are same because there is a boy and a girl in the movie.From the above rating you can see I liked Gully Boy, music and performances are very good. rapping looks natural. Alia Bhatt is a fire cracker in the movie. I just wish there is lot more to the story. its a worth a watch. Please dont listen to anyone who says its copied from 8 mile, watch both movies to decide for yourself.

A story which justifies the hype it created before even releasing. There's alot to the other than just big names. The contribution of Zoya Akhtar's whole team is brilliant and is visible throughout. The film has a gripping narrative. It has a lot of parallel stories which are quite clear due to Zoya's brilliant directing. Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt have delivered great performances which were expected. Siddhant Chaturvedi is also a delight to watch. The authenticity of the film if commendable.

Was happy to see a new style (rapper-based) movie being produced by Bollywood. I am not a fan of such music, but can always appreciate a movie. And, honestly, that was the good part of the movie. Then there are side stories which were more like the 60's style and dragged the movie down - making it boring at times. Alia and Siddhant were the best. Ranveer decent. The finale was a bit let down. Just too much of celebration which didn't emotionally connect with me. I was happy that it was finally over. Compare this movie to Dangal, Secret Superstar, Chak De India, etc. and you will see that it lacks life.

This film sort of felt like a cross between '8 Mile' and 'A Star is Born', but set in India. It's a slightly odd comparison but those two films have to come to mind while watching it. Intercutting rap battles into this tale of rags to riches is actually a concept that worked much more than I would have thought. What I think also helped is the addition of a fiery romance, a cultural family dispute and a terrific ensemble cast. There's a fair amount of humour too, which provides well timed relief to some of the emotional drama. Overall, Gully boy seamlessly blends romance, drama and comedy situations and a well-meaning message that rings true in today's society.
Poor guy wants to become a rapper, but society suppresses him, finally against all the odds, poor guy becomes a famous rapper. Inspiring story, but I found the movie to be a drag at times.

Not fully relatable to the foreign audience but apparently touches the core of the street life in Mumbai..Great acting. Music could've been better but the director wanted the audience to delve into the story and not digress into music

I love Ranveer Singh. He tries to give his best towards whatever project he takes. But nearly half of his movies are unnecessarily dragged to the point it gets uninteresting. Gully Boy is also one of the same only it got so boring I had to stop watching. The story could've been easily stopped at the 2 hour range but they chose to go on forever.

reviews.review_title: "Change your reality to match your dreams"
reviews.content: Gully Boy is an extraordinary film about a young Muslim student from the slums of Mumbai, who is a fan of hip-hop music and who keeps secret his dreams to make it big in the rap music scene. It is the kind of film that hooks you right from the first moments and just keeps growing on you as it goes on. The story, the setting, the cinematography, the music, the characters, and the narrative all contribute to the film's unusual feel in equal parts. The Dharavi slums of Mumbai where the film is set are shot beautifully - the congested streets, overcrowded with a diverse population of individuals, much to the point where poverty, and often sad pictures thereof, is presented as almost culturally exotic. It's amazing though that specifically these disheartening, seemingly impossible areas bring forth heartening messages of hope and opportunity where neither dire straits nor harsh realities can take them away.The film's narrative style is fantastic - it IS music. Its youthful, modern feel is there all through and, even those not particularly fond of rap music, are very likely to enjoy the rhythm and the many songs which decorate the proceedings in ways one could not imagine. The lyrics of the songs, as well as the rap sequences as performed by the characters of the film, turn out to be symbolic and poetic and very true of the challenging conditions of the speakers in question. The cinematography is stupendous, the lighting and diverse shots make it quite a visual treat in many ways and, as mentioned above, even despite the setting of not the prettiest locales. Apart from Ranveer Singh as Murad, the film's leading actor who's an aspiring singer, and Safeena, his charming and headstrong girlfriend, every character is given a story, which is part of the entire picture of a society often immersed in its primitive ways, like, for one, his bigamous father or her conservative parents.And the acting, as part of this entire picture, is spot on. Every member of the cast is natural to the hilt. Singh obviously leads the cast with an excellent performance. His portrayal of his character's reserved nature, insecurity, and then his inner self-belief in his ability to make it, is fantastic. In a smaller part, Alia Bhatt is wonderful as the free-spirited Sakeena, and she almost steals the thunder as she is highly relatable, convincing and above all enjoyable in how ambitious, determined and madly in love she is. Without taking anything away from the two leads, the supporting cast is full of stupendous character actors, led by a brilliant Amruta Subhash in a heartbreaking portrayal of Murad's mother. Vijay Raaz, as her abusive and adulterous husband, is superb, and so is Vijay Varma, as the troublemaker Moeen. Siddhant Chaturvedi is a nice find as he fits the role and does exceedingly although he does look over-confident at points, and Kalki is given a thankless role though she's good.Gully Boy is a rare combination of top-notch acting, story, music, and soul. It works as both a musical, a sports film of sorts, and a human drama. In the end, it's just very inspiring. For director Zoya Akhtar, this is clearly the best film of her career, as no film of hers, even the most celebrated and acclaimed (and some, overrated), reached the merit and beauty of this one. This film has clearly a lot invested into, and not just money but hard work in studying and preparing, because it takes us into the world as those who too often are deemed transparent, and it makes them matter. Many years ago, a movement of Indian films known as parallel cinema was producing films which often sought to give voice to the voiceless, namely people from the slums. It's nice seeing that their stories have crossed the boundaries of what was called "offbeat cinema" and is now given importance by mainstream filmmakers. That mass audiences find their stories valuable is not surprising, but Indian cinema is maturing, and it's great.

This is such a beautifully made film. It's very rare that one walks out of a film thinking of the world in a different way. When the film starts to the end, the director(Zoya Akhtar), makes sure the audience is hooked. Dialogue writer Vijay Maurya, also played by Murad(Ranveer's uncle) wrote some amazing dialogues and a script that not only neatly ties on the gully boy himself, but his love interest, relationships with his family, friends, and his inner demons.
Ranveer has slowly become Indian's Daniel Day Lewis. There is no trace of him in Murad. He is sensitive, daring, intense, and quiet. He breaths fire as he sits in his car, and raps his heart and arms out. He is brooding as he sits and writes after he sees his father's second wife come in his home. He doesn't miss a beat. Alia is growing from strength to strength. After, Udta, Dear Zindagi, Raazi, and now Gully Boy, is the latest in her kitty of great performances. A special mention to Siddarth and Vijay Varma for giving us such lovely characters to root for. Also Vijay Raaz as the abusive father. I hated him and that's a testament to how great Raaz is as an artist.
This movie is a must see. Go in and you'll be happy to spend Valentine's Day with Zoya and her team whom have gifted us this extradinary film. Hard Hai Boss!

My rating is because something different is been tried in Bollywood.It might be copy of some Hollywood movie but still new steps been taken to break the walls and try something New.The movie is entertaining but might not be liked by some.Ranveer is the male protagonist and Alia's role and acting is commendable and all other Co-actors have equally done a good job.it's a one time watch for sure.

Ok..so i was hyped with movie bcoz of the reviews it got and the people are praising that you haven't seen anything like this in india..well i just wanna say i was really disappointed.There is nothing new here...the same underdog story has been told many times in different ways.
Acting is good which you can expect from fine actors so nothing special about that and overall it's just an average movie.

reviews.review_title: A must watch for everyone who dream
reviews.content:
Everyone have one movie in life which make them do something, change them, and help them discover themselves and for me GULLY BOY is that kind of movie. This is Ranveer Singh's best performance and best movie till date. The best part of this movie was there was no unwanted gimmicks done to show the character that 'only one' and who had gotten everything ready in his plate like one other recently released movie that came ;~)
Alia Bhatt like always was fabulous although there was not so much for her to do in this movie. All other cast were also great. And special mention for the writers of this movie who brought such a terrific plot in accordance with the character.

This movie has been copied alot from 8-Mile!
Please do not give credit to the writers for this movie.

reviews.review_title: Length, linear, predictable and linear. One time watch
reviews.content:
It is just a lengthy, highly predictable, linear film... I must admit, it wasn't boring but not interesting as well... Not enough hard to be called 'Boht hard'...What worked: Performancs of Mechanic/Dope dealer, Ranveer's father, MC Sher, Ranveer and Alia (in the same order). Dialogues were pretty ordinary though cinematography was really good. Female right theme.What didn't: Very lengthy, too predictable, unnecessary subplots (entire Kalki Kochlin subplot), very linear story, tried too hard to insert unnecessary drama.
Some things that I found really hard to digest like a person who is Car Theif/Dope dealer/ and indulges in child labour gets bail just like that and also tries to justify these acts by saying that HE FEEDS THESE KIDS.Also at many points, one way or another, it was forced on audience that all working class people suck because they are not following their passion/dream jobs. This is easier said than done thing but ok, it was a movie so I can manage that.Final Words: Lengthy, predictable, one time watch film but definitely NOT boht hard.

The similaritieswith 8 Mile is just in the basic premise and whatever was shown in the trailer. This film does stands on its own.Simple story filled with complex characters (well all the characters from the Gully anyway) beautifully directed. Ranveer Singh is fantastic as expected. The only issue for me was that the climax could have been a bit more intense for such a story.

The film is watchable for Zoya's direction and Siddhant's performance. There is nothing new in the film - it is the age-old underdog story, and I have seen much better depictions of the underdog story in world cinema. Some sections/ communities of the society may be able to connect with the film and its characters, but I could not. Also, if you are from Mumbai, you may like the film. In terms of performances, Ranveer is better here than in some of his last films. Alia has acted like she always does - just being the normal herself. The real performance for which to check out this film is Siddhant's. This is an actor to watch out for.
Disclaimer: There is too much rap in the film. I have tried to be as impartial in my review as possible - if you are not a fan of this so-called "music" like myself, you may not like it.

reviews.review_title: A film for mumbaikers: hard hai bantai
reviews.content:
Its an entertaining movie to watch for and is worth watching too..
Mostly the mumbaikers can relate to the movie as the whole movie is based in Dharavi.
Everyone is good with their character and it was great to see Vijay Raaz as always. He is indeed a very good actor.
To the one who don't understands the rap culture, the movie will be quite overrated but trust me its not.
To the one saying the movie is a copy of 8 miles must watch the movie, this is how the story of rapper can be exactly displayed.
And Ranveer was outstanding with his part and "Apna Time Aayega" is just outstanding work by Ranveer, If you feel the character then its also an inspiring story..
According to me its definitely worth watching :)
And the one calling Ranveer Singh's character as overacting are the one who don't understand Mumbai's local language

reviews.review_title: First 2 minutes plus of, it's brought to you by.
reviews.content:
Film starts with Ranveer and his 2 friends stealing a vehicle. Why would anyone start a film with that?
I still watched the film, but it never gets any better.
Somewhere in between I felt as if it is copy of 8 miles and slumdog millionaire. However, the similarity is just in premise.
Best film ever in this century.. Ranveer is outstanding he is superb

Saw the movie yesterday.. what an amazing and flawless film. I don't think I've truly experienced a film this close to heart. Every charcter, every frame is etched and performed to perfection. Murad, Safeena, Sher, Moeen - they all win your hearts. Brilliant supporting cast Amruta Subhash Vijay Raaz and others. Go watch it and give the movie Box office validation as such world-class film are made in rarity in the mainstream cinema. Gully Boy is an experience with music and Murad at it's core.

Cant call this a real life story, most of the scenes are copied from 8 miles, like RS chock in a Rap battle, Problems in family the Tiger comes for help and even some lyrics used in the Rap battles were lifted from 8 miles, sorry to write this there is nothing new in this film
2 hrs ka darad , over-rated sshhiitt. Dnt waste ur time . How could such a worst movie sent for Oscar.

Bollywood is flourishing to new heights with creative stories like this one. Gully Boy is a fantastic film with a fascinating story. Ranveer Singh is brilliant as the hidden talent-family struggles kind of guy and shines as the movie progresses. I also really enjoyed Siddhanth for outshining Ranveer in some scenes as his sidekick. But I will say that Alia Bhatt was unnecessary in the movie, though she was brilliant as her character. Also I felt that the movie could have been cut short by 15-20 minutes since it was a bit too long. Other than that I really enjoyed it till the end.

This film has this one human insight. That without the blessings of your loved ones, neighbours, caretakers, you can't rise. It's only with that goodwill that you can make your life special. Also by taking everyone along. And we all have to do that.For that one insight this film is worth watching twice!Loved Alia bhat's Safina. She was my most favourite character. More than Murad. loved Murad too. Specially the choice of the name.Loved Vijay Varma's Moin. Made me cry. What a performer. The way he says 'trap' Ho gaya at the end. Wow!
Waste of money...I wish I could've have given 0 star for this
Gully Boy is a nice underdog story which has it's heart in right place. Full marks to Zoya Akhtar here for the over-all execution. The cast has some very good performances.
Don't know why this movie is was flop, i really enjoyed this movie those dialogues, bits, BGM was awesome a must watch film....

reviews.review_title: A rip-roaring revelatcon of Indian Rap culture is a new direction in Bollywood
reviews.content:
Viewed at Berlin, 2029. Gully Boy, india, directed by Zoya Akhtar.(46) seems to be pointing Bollywood in a new direction away from the Masala formula loaded with often irrelevant mass dance numbers and focussing on the lives of the wealthy upper classes. "Gully" is one Hindi word for-street from which the less common English word "gulley" is derived and immediately informs viewers to get ready for something different. Set in the infamous Mumbai slum of Dharavi Gully Boy is in a way a local response to Danny Boyle's 2008 world wide success "Slumdog Millionaire", focusing, of all things, on the recent Indian craze for Hop Hop and Rap music and the lives of the slum dwellers.
Murad, a 22-year-old youngster in an Islamic ghetto family (Ranveer Singh), knows he has a way with words and dreams of making it in the rapper world but only as a composer because he is too shy to take the stage himself. He us encouraged by successful rapper, Sher, (the Lion) to mouth his own words at the mike and is warmly received. Eventually he will enter an aggressive Rapper duel with an enormous cash prize for the winner. Meanwhile his ultra conservative father takes a dim view of Murad's ambitions and demands that he follow up an education to be a white collar worker. Needless to say, in the end Murad will triumph but not before the obstacles of poverty and resignation to lowe classness have been overcome. His feisty girlfriend (Alia Bhatt) provides him with moral support. At 33 Ranveer is maybe a little long in the tooth to play such a youngster but he has charisma to burn and pulls it off with restraint and verve. With this off beat role he has clearly established himself as the leading actor in Bollywood. SRK move over. And you do not need to be a hip hop fan to get on this swift roller coaster of a ride and enjoy it to the hilt. Not in competition Gully Boy was nevertheless a rousing experience, feel-good in its own way, and one of the better films seen at this festival
Zoya Akhtar, stemming from a prominent Indian film family, is not only the only major female director in Bollywood, but one if its very smartest, most effective and most skillful. A leading figure of the new Bollywood until now totally male dominated.

Gully Boy This is the first of it's kind in Bollywood. Rapping was extremely popular back in 90's-2000 in Hollywood. Majority of the plot is from a Eminem movie back in early 2000, 8 Mile. Gully boy has also copied major plots from a few popular movies of it's own industry. The ratings were high and i booked because it's been a while since i've seen a movie on the big screen. Movie started and this happened......Ranveer Singh This man is gifted. His dedication to the character he plays, be it a King, Street Artist, Businessman etc., he sweeps the audience off the floor. MC Sher, he played beautifully too. Might i say, I think he played a stronger street rapper than Ranveer himself.This movie, although much was predictable is a fine cocktail of many things that lifts your spirit high and you leave the theatre with a bit of adrenaline rush and a smile.Peace out!
Must watch direction, screenplay ,acting everything is good in this movie
Bollywood seems to be on downward spiral and losing originality every passing day. This movie is another copy from Hollywood again. What a waste!!

Left me speechless!!
Amazed by the actors
Everything is just perfect you should watch this for sure

Finally after a long, Bollywood movie which length was over 2 hours 30 min was worth watching.
Great story
Great performance
Great screen play and
a GREAT MOVIE
We are just a halfway through this year but with a due respect for other actors, I want Ranveer Singh to win Filmfare for this movie. Never liked Ranveer Singh but he is one of the superstars who will be celebrated for long.

This movie was in my bucket list since it's first teaser was launched, maybe because I follow HipHop and rap music and also I am a motivation seeker, I know a lot of the facts about rappers naezy and Divine before this but story interests me alot...
Alia's character as well as her acting was marvelous
This movie is debut movie for Sidhdhaant chaturvedi playing MC Sher and did a tremendous job here...
Ranveer is always high on the energy and this role suited him...What goes Wrong-
Emotions of the scenes were changing very quickly and timeline is also very abstract, for a person who doesn't know hip hop/Rap culture it's difficult to understand the storyline
The climax was not satisfying it must be extended or shouldn't ended up too soon...

reviews.review_title: One word for this movie totally Disappointed
reviews.content:
First thing it is copy of 8 mile
Ranveer Singh overacting very bad performance..
Alia performance is good....
Direction is average
Screen play is also average
This movie was such a masterpiece like andhadhun.....im watching this movie again and again... Love it...

reviews.review_title: Good Bollywood Slow-burner; Rags-to-riches story meets Rap/Hip-Hop.
reviews.content: My Rating : 8/10Quintessential Bollywood Hip-Hop Movie with the usual rags-to-riches fairytale storyline.The songs are extremely well-written and composed, the drama ensuing between all the characters is a typical Bollywood affair and fairly cliched but works because of great performances from everyone.Kudos to the team for pulling off a super cool, entertaining and engaging movie!
Acting direction screenplay especially music everything is just 👌👌

The movie is really beautifully directed, the best part of the movie it shows the sad reality of our day to day life but regardless the movie is full of "Junoon" haha I forgot this word almost, love the music, love the direction, actually loved everything in the movie, every character is nicely played. #Gullyboyreview: it was simply"Wow". It's not a movie which grabs you immediately but it slowly creeps up on you and by the end of the movie you end up wanting more. Every single actor had done justice to their parts. Ranvir and Alia are phenomenal as always but Siddhant Chaturvedi as MC Sher shines through. From the shy young boy in Inside Edge, his metamorphosis is quite remarkable. The film is not without it's potboiler stuff and there is an uncanny resemblance to '8 mile', but all of that fades away when the rapping and the rhythm begins. I don't remember wishing for a sequel to a movie in recent times but I can't wait for gully boy 2.

Murad's Mom Speaks Feminism ! His Dad Speaks Male Dominance ! Alia Bhatt Speaks A Love Of Poor And The Loyalty In Love ! The Music Work Was Awesome ! The Camera Work At Its Best ! Especially The One Shot Takes ! The Negative Is They Only Show The Ignorance For Murad But Not The Struggle He Went Through To Win ! So He Wont Be Remembered Longer ! My Opinion Is Gully Boy Can Win Awards But Not Oscar ! There Are Also Other Better Movies From India !

reviews.review_title: Little India Directory Review: Gully Boy (6 Stars)
reviews.content: Gully Boy (Street Boy) is full of energy. So full of energy that I couldn't take my eyes off the screen for nearly 3 hours as this blend of hip hop music and dramatic performances put me in a state of daze. Unfortunately, when I was finally out of that daze, the humdrum, polished story stared me at the face, making me feign the gloomy air of a rapper that he assumes when he realizes he just got owned by his opponent in a street rap battle.Hard-nosed Ranveer Singh plays the central character of Murad - dreamer, boyfriend of aspiring surgeon and rough-and-tough human being Safeena (Alia Bhatt), Engineering student, and a member of an extended family where the guardian and sole breadwinner (Vijay Raaz) has just recently married for the second time. In that order. Although, if it was for Safeena to decide, she would change that order and maybe even murder a woman or two to get that done. But since the screenplay is written for the masses by Akhtar and co-writer Reema Kagti, with substantial support from dialogue writer of the year Vijay Maurya, Gully Boy flows like a rap song. The poetry is very good and "hard" considering the rhythm by an ensemble of musicians including Divine and Raezy (Mumbai-based rappers on whose story the film is based), Raghu Dixit, and Mickey McCleary makes the viewers get out of their seats and dance like Murad does sometime during the slow-paced second half of the film.At first glance, the short slices of scenes made me believe that I was watching the trailer of Gully Boy. And then the screenplay started to bring long shots into the mix and made me laugh my stomach off. As I have noted earlier, writer Maurya vomits knowledge and experience of street language into the screenplay, not only surprising you at the rawness of the sequences that it complements but also amusing you to a level that you fall in love with the characters. Although I am not a fan of Murad or his ambitions, I was blown away by newcomer Siddhant Chaturvedi and his introductory character of MC Sher. It almost felt like I was watching a real-life street rapper spread wisdom about hip hop and the real world among his peers. And whenever he spoke - which is akin to how he raps - it felt like I was experiencing an experience that I had never experienced in Hindi cinema. Sure, films about street urchins - down and out - but dreaming big and humming "apna time aayega" ("our time will come"), have been presented before, but not with so much energy and finesse. A good look at the scenes involving the slums of Mumbai and their people will enthrall you like only a few films have in the history of Hindi cinema.If the music comes in first in this race (with "Apna Time Aayega" sung by Ranveer Singh and Divine taking the pie by at least eight miles from the second track Doori also by Singh), then the cast performance definitely gets the silver medal. Both Singh and Bhatt are phenomenal in what they do, especially enacting the appearance and behaviour of the poor. The latter just hits the roof with her enactment of Safeena, a ferocious true bred and highbrow, independent woman in mad love with the man of her life. Even if the film's energy as a whole gets compared with Singh's and the latter wins, there is much more to relish about the rest of the cast. Performances by everyone, notably including Vijay Raaz, Chaturvedi, Vijay Varma, Kalki Koechlin, and Amruta Subhash are a treat to watch. It won't be surprising if you wonder if these actors were made for the roles that they portray so effectively, uplifting the understanding of the social issues that I mentioned earlier.Yet there is a pungent, uncomfortable element about Gully Boy that prevents you from calling it extraordinary. The story of a guy stricken with poverty trying to make it big in the millennium city is as common as a piece of garbage lying around in the same city. How perseverance and patience gets you ahead is another point that Akhtar brings into the fore, all the more making me question the point of such a film. Of course, the musicians have done a splendid work writing the songs and producing them, but I am not seeing any special reason or a special factor that would differentiate Gully Boy from an ordinary biopic about a person who tries to make it big in life. And that is what restrains me from singing any more praises of Gully Boy and avoiding the peak-end rule. Because those final 10 minutes are manically fantastic. But I will definitely say this: the music will uplift your mood like no other film has in a long, long time. And if that's your cue, then Gully Boy should be in front of your eyes this weekend.Director Zoya Akhtar somehow always manages to make even the most humdrum of stories into ravishing pieces of art. Gully Boy is no different even if you look at it from the perspective of a person who hopes to see social issues being addressed through cinema. For it also marvelously hints at issues such as social status and inequality and wealth and even (Islamic) polygamy to an extent. The excellent camera work by Jay Oza will make you want to watch it for the second time on the big screen despite of this review. And that is the kind of movies that Akhtar makes, only to find them being watched and rewatched by cinephiles years from now.Gully Boy gets everything right and pumps up your mood regardless of what position you are in in your own life, but just thinking about it a few hours after you have seen it will make you realize that it just falls short of becoming something that can be dubbed as extraordinary. TN.Originally appeared in the Little India Directory (Singapore).

Director Zoya Akthar's Gully Boy is an affective underdog story that is well executed and supported by solid performances by the leads as well as a competent supporting cast. It presents the story of Murad, a resident of the slums of Dharavi, Mumbai and his rise to become an acclaimed rap artist despite the odds that are stacked against him that seek to trap him forever in his suffocating circumstances. The narrative arc traces his journey of self discovery and how he harnesses his innate talents and self belief to become a famous rap artist by "melting down the shackles that bind him with the lava of his lyrics".I have never been a big fan of the genre of hip hop/ rap music. But, there is an earnest intensity in the album and the hard-hitting lyrics (collaboration by an array of artists) here that captivates the viewer and hooks them to the genre.Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhat prove their mettle as the definitive stars in the making, oozing loads of talent and cement their billing to be counted among the very best of their generation of actors. This film provides a perfect stage for them to collaborate and shine together. Ranveer is like some shimmering liquid metal that could be perfectly cast to fit into any mould. He can effortlessly transform from being an obsessed and cruel medieval Sultan in Padmavat to the underdog from Mumbai slum and make either part feel very real.Here, he is inhabiting the part of Murad, a Dharavi resident dreaming of elevating his life from a rag-tag, down-in-the-dumps reality to match his soaring dreams. And, it definitely doesn't hurt that he can also rap like a pro. Alia Bhatt lights up the screen as the charming Safeena, a pint sized dynamite of a medical student, madly in love with Murad. She shares a warm chemistry with Ranveer, complementing him effectively.Zoya assembles a string of notable names like Vijay Raaz, Kalki Koechlin, Vijay Verma, Sheeba Chaddha as well as debutante Siddhant Chaturvedi (as MC Sher) who turn in impressive cameos along with multiple real life rap artists who add a dash of authentic flavour of the music and the milieu, especially in the fierce rap battles. The crisp cinematography (Jay Oza) and the conversations soaked in the local lingo add to the lived in feel to the proceedings.The writing (Zoya and Reema Kagti) is dexterous for the most part and manages to breath a dash of freshness even into some time tested tropes and cliches. The result is an extra-ordinary movie that is engrossing and satisfying at multiple levels.

Fine piece of story telling.
Siddhant shines although with less screen presence.
A delight to watch.

Zoya Akhtar films have been all about urban rich lifestyle films such as Luck by chance ZNMD Dil Dhadakne Do but Gully Boy is completely different from her previous outings and she nailed it with the story(along with Reema Kagti) and captured the slums of Mumbai with almost perfection! I've been a huge fan of Divine Naezy songs like Mere Gully Mein Jungli Sher Kaam 25 etc. Zoya didn't disappoint in showcasing the underground rap battles and slums of Mumbai which marvelled me.Story: Murad(Ranveer Singh) is an aspiring rapper who lives in the slums of Mumbai along with his abusive father(Vijay Raaz), mother, grandmother, a brother and a step mother. He's in relationship with his childhood love Safeena(Alia Bhatt) and friends with Moeen(Vijay Verma), Salman and others. His life takes a turn when he encounters with MC Sher(Siddhant Chaturvedi) who turns him into the GULLY BOY.Performances: Ranveer Singh nails it with his performance in this film. I initially found him as an above average actor who's best comes out only from Bhansali and Deepika, but after Simmba he proved me wrong and with this film he shut everyone's mouth, especially with the climax. Alia Bhatt is natural in her approach, her performance can be felt as she lived the character of Safeena, the pain can be seen in her eyes. Vijay Raaz, Vijay Verma, Sheeba Chadha everyone performed well, though I wanted more of Kalki Koechlin who had least screen presence. But the one who steals the show from Ranveer and other actors has to be Siddhant Chaturvedi! BOY HE NAILED THE LOOK AND MANNERISMS OF A RAPPER! His entry was the best, his screen presence was amazing and overshadowing Ranveer is not everyone's cup of tea. Can't say he's the same man from Inside Edge who was shown as a weak guy, he completely transformed himself as the MIGHTY MC SHER! For this role a star was required and hats off to Zoya for making a debutant a star of the film!The plot looses the grip in second half to some extent but nevertheless the climax makes up for everything, when Ranveer raps his heart out and promised APNA TIME AAYEGA, arey Ranveer baba aapka time toh aa gaya!Going 9/10 especially for superlative performances and music

If I take Siddhant Chaturvedi out of the movie, this is a bad movie. Despite my love for Ranveer Singh, I would have preferred him picking a better script and a better performance than S.Chaturvedi gave in the movie.

Great movie - nicely paced, AMAZING lyrics, great songs, awesome performance from Ranveer, great performance by Alia Bhatt, well researched and thorough script, wonderful direction, non-intrusive cinematography.Ranveer Singh has been truly outstanding. Subdued persona of Murad has been very well imbibed. When loud and forceful rap songs are being sung, it is clear that Murad is the one singing.Aliah has an easier role to pull off. She plays a bold and open girl who wears her heart on her sleeve. And she has portrayed Safeena just as brilliantly.In the form of rap fights, movie takes stances - good takes, some of them very well worded by Javed Akhthar. Multiple independent perspectives of a few varied topics presented nicely through rap.Very realistic and convincing characterizations of not only the protagonists, but also the households, the slums etc. Reminded me of Vada Chennai.Loved the ending of the movie - unlike the meticulous thread closures. All questions answered still. While "Luck by Chance" was a pretty good movie, "Gully Boy" definitely feels so much more perfect."My dreams will not change to match my reality. My reality will change to match my dreams."I can see this movie getting all over the psyche of young aspirants. Dream on - apna time aayega!

reviews.review_title: A terrific underdog poetry on celluloid
reviews.content: Gully Boy not just about Ranveer's rap music underground world, it's beyond that! Zoya Akthar brings this street boy(Murad) out of his Dharavi slum life, gives him hope to dream, battle his struggles to become an aspiring hip hop rap musician, she keeps it realistic all the way! Ranveer was on terrific form, he was passionate, he lit up the audition rap scenes, owed it to the superb Siddhant Chaturvedi on the supporting role as MC Sher! Man killed it big time in Apna Time Aayega showdown, rapped it himself! The movie consist of banger of tracks(credits to bunch of musicians involved) but thought Zoya strike the right chords, keep it authentic for the sake of story and explode it towards the ending! Alia bhatt's Safeena was all heart! and This man Ranveer Singh is one helluva showman! Amazing film!

Gully Boy is a journey of journeys full of words, visuals, expressions, lyrics and story lines. You, the viewer, get to focus on elements that appeal to your senses and take out as much or as little as you want out of it. There are innumerable reviews and articles on great performances and catchy rap songs and its all true.
So instead of repeating the same, let me focus on some of the masterfully crafted journeys where you accompany the characters and open different dimensions of emotions and people who are just like us. Its long, full of spoilers but no apologies.Very skilfully, we are conveyed how Murad's (Ranveer Singh's) world is dark, almost claustrophobic before he gets to taste some success. Notice the lights, celebrations and reflections around him when he's sitting alone in darkness, on a new year's eve as a hesitant driver in a car.In the same job and two different journeys Murad comes face to face with the life of more affluent youth and it somehow tells him about his own struggle. In first instance, his boss is told off for giving up on education and how he himself with his hopes of being a graduate will still just leave him at the lowest wrung of society.
In the other, while his boss is crying in the backseat of the car, his pathos gushes out in the form of rap lyrics about how our social class structure prohibits him from reaching out just a few inches across and offer some solace.There are rides with Murad and other youth just like him stealing cars - at times for money and at other just for joyrides, maybe just taking out their angst of belonging to the have-nots class and being stuck with it - naukar ka beta hamesha naukar rahega, no matter how hard they try.
Another brief scene of a bored looking multitude of people in local train drives home the point - this is how you end up if you are born poor - just one in millions and no hope being any better.Then there are the bus journeys with Safeena (Alia Bhatt) which beautifully convey how the only way to hide their relationship is in plain sight, in public transport. In a society as hypocritical and divided as India, that's true for many other couples as well.And then there is the more deserved joyride for Murad with Sky (Kalki Koechlin) in her car. This time he is exposed to what a rich, affluent minority thinks is wrong with the world. And then we realise what the so called educated class doesn't get - multitudes of people like Murad are still struggling with the lack of basics - Roti, Kapda, Makaan and now maybe internet too.At the end of same journey we get to see a more pronounced flaw in Murad that makes him all the more human - he sort of cheats on his girl friend of 9 years. In the director's own words - why wouldn't he ? After all its his chance of crossing over and be with a person from the other side of society which otherwise wouldn't even acknowledge his presence.It's a four and half stars from me.P.S. So far I thought Ranveer was just another overrated wannabe. But he proves himself a worthy actor with this movie. In case you happen to read this, an apology first and then Well done Ranveer!

reviews.review_title: I was WRONG to compare Gully Boy with 8 Miles
reviews.content: I was wrong like most of the people to compare the Zoya Akhtar's latest flick, Gully Boy, with Eminem's rap-battle Hollywood flick, 8 Mile (2002). In fact, I was disappointed after watching the trailer of Gully Boy and thought - why would a brilliant director like Zoya Akhtar would copy a film from Hollywood ? Is she out of her mind ?Gully Boy is a hard-hitting drama on the world of rappers in slum area of Dharavi. Ranveer Singh is essaying the role of an aspiring rapper and wants to make it big despite all the opposition.I was awe-struck by the Zoya Akhtar's school of film-making when I watched her first film, Luck By Chance. I fell in love with her style after witnessing the cinematic excellence in form of Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara. Though Dil Dhadakne Do was decent, Gully Boy surprised me. Mind you, I was half-asleep when I started watching Gully Boy but my eyes were wide shut open after 15 minutes as I was enjoying each and every moment of first-ever rap battle drama made on Indian silver screen. The moment you start the film, you will be engrossed into the world of Dharavi in Mumbai, considered to be one of the largest slums in Asia. Zoya wonderfully captures the lives of people staying in Dharavi which is simple and yet enriching. Each and every frame beautifully showcases the energy and moments of Dharavi's culture. We are also introduced to the world of Murad and Safeena (brilliantly played by Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt). Since this is a musical drama, the rap music (though alien to the Indian culture) is used in the background along with beat-boxing and goes well with the flow of the film.The second half focus on the beautiful line "You Only Get One Shot .. Do Not Miss Your Chance To Blow" from the song "Lose Yourself" by Eminem from the 8 Mile movie as Murad finally achieves his dream. Hats off to Zoya daring to make a film like Gully Boy even though it stars big names and a big shout to the writers (Zoya herself, Vasundhara Koshy, Reema Kagti and Vijay Maurya) for keeping you engaged till the end (by this time, I was energized and motivated). The songs are wonderfully composed and choreographed, especially with the well-written lyrics. Dialogues are outstanding. Zoya had used the poem from Javed Akhtar (same way she did in ZNMD) and I liked it. On the flip side, the length of the film could have been reduced while the story becomes predictable.Coming to the performances, there is nothing in the world which Ranveer Singh cannot do. The actor who is coming fresh from the success of Padmaavat and Simmba, has moved into a complete different direction with Gully Boy. He does not show the energy this time but emotes superbly through his eyes. He plays the character whom you could easily relate to as many of us have dreams, the spark in our eyes and the fire in our heart to do something which you are born to do. Alia Bhatt is OUTSTANDING. Even though this is a Ranveer Singh's film, the gorgeous actress plays the role of a possessive girlfriend with T. Watch for the scene when she rubs her cheeks before meeting Ranveer Singh in the second half. I liked Siddhant Chaturvedi who plays the mentor to Murad. Vijay Raaz was usual brilliant.Overall, Gully Boy is one of the best cinematic experience to watch and I would highly recommend to watch it. Excellent 4/5

Journey of rags to riches story taken in a beautiful way without an usual upper class antagonist. Its rather, the family and surroundings of protagonist that clouds him and questions him constantly. That is why this movie clicks and is most relatable to anyone. The dialogues and music score throughout the film is just brilliant and stays true to the story on 'Indian Rap culture'. Definitely, do watch and get inspired!!

reviews.review_title: One of the Good Movies of year 2019
reviews.content: Its a well made movie by director 'Zoya Akhtar". Movie has got every thing story, acting, well music...I would like to tell one truth, After watching the trailer release of the movie. I thought the movie might be a resemblance of movie "8 Mile" of Eminem. But all the doubts were cleared after watching the movie Gully Boy. No its not "8 Mile" movie resemblance. The story is really griping how a struggling poor Rapper from Mumbai slums becomes Indian Rap start at the end.If one has time then its a definitely a watch movie, It is one of the well made movie of year 2019.

reviews.review_title: Best Acting, Direction and Script writing
reviews.content: After long time watch a worth Bollywood movie. Satisfied for the money spent on the Cenema ticket. Zoya's direction was great in this movie. I was trying to find an error between the line but there wasn't. Movie has taken the suffering of the life, emotion and at the same time make sure that there was a happy moment which people will not fall on boring feelings. Every single rap lyrics were attached with the characters. Movie has taken 4 female characters to show different aspects of an Indian woman. Alia's character was living in typical Muslim family that she has limited social attachment where it made her bit of narrow mided and at the same time she was bit of understanding since she was educated. Otherhand, Sky was the opposite character that lives in different country and culture who understands the practicality and social requirements. Mother of Murad was typical house wife who compromised her happiness for selfish husband and who's struggling by sacrificing herself. Step mother of Murad was again a typical wife who is just second wife of a married man. These characters give an idea that, the way women had been grown will matter for their behaviours and decision makings. We always having a feeling that, rappers means drug addict or drinkers. Director took that tag line literally away. Many occasions shown that he was not alcoholic and it was accepted within the rappers and he wasn't forced at any occasion. Again, dress code- imagination of a rapper is toned pant, three quarters, bigger t shirts, hats and hoods... Murad was winning his first competition with his normal office dress.Movie was a very detailed movie which have shown many angles of the characters and life structure of a Gully Boy!!! Loved it.

Perfect direction, story line, narratives and absolutely spot on cast.Must watch for all Indian cinema fans. Overall movie is 9/10.Giving it 10 due to soft corner for overall rap scene. Have been listening to Rap music since late 90s. :)
Just a f'ckin DRAMA movie. Pure BS. Tatti movie BC.
Found this on Amazon prime, don't normally watch Indian movies, but this was so good and refreshing, nice story good acting.

reviews.review_title: A Coming of Age Story that Reflects the Dreams of the Downtrodden in our Country
reviews.content: A film that explores the Underground HipHop Culture brewing in the slums of Mumbai & through it the larger theme of how the Class difference forces a lot of people to destroy their dreams. The Direction is superb from Zoya Akhtar, this one is her best work. All the performances are memorable especially Ranveer, Alia & Vijay. Ranveer who has a larger than life persona, had to give a very subdued & subtle performance whereas Alia produces a firecracker one. The Music has become Stuff of Legends. I really didnt find any glaring mistakes in this film so had to give a perfect score.

reviews.review_title: It's not about one individual struggling to succeed it about every one who wants to succeed
reviews.content: The movie is very well directed and shows the ups and downs a person trying to create space for himself goes through. The acting has been superb. Only one point I feel is movie could have been bit shorter since couple of the places were like repeated not adding any additional information.
Don't read any reviews just go and watch the film....And judge it yourself..

reviews.review_title: Gully Boy should stay in his gully except for MC Sher
reviews.content: Except the music, the movie is predictable and a big nothing burger. Yes, it is not 8 mile because it can't touch it at any measure, even the rap tracks. Ranveer Singh looks like an adult man trying to be young college dude and he shouldn't have rapped at all by himself. Alia Bhatt 's role is not about an empowered woman but just about a dramabaaz. As usual, her acting is linear and loud. It is a movie that put Indian rap scene in spotlight and the only saving grace of the film is MC Sher played by Siddhant Chaturvedi. He was so charming and was perfectly billed for his role. He stole the show from everyone.

Movie has taken 4 female characters to show different aspects of an Indian woman. Alia's character was living in typical Muslim family that she has limited social attachment where it made her bit of narrow mided and at the same time she was bit of understanding since she was educated. I am not a great fan of rap music, but this film got me hooked. Thanks to Zoya s direction and fabulous actors she chose. Thoroughly enjoyed the film.

Decent film with lots of good characters. Not a rap fan but this made it fun! My big problem was with the main character, Murad. He is far too old for the role, and is supposed to be almost the same age as his girlfriend. But she looks about 20 and he in his thirties! Also he is part of a troubled modest family living in cramped conditions, yet he is constantly lounging around with his gym toned body and floppy seventies hair. He's supposed to be an undergraduate in his final year yet never seen studying. He also seems quite posh and not at all street. The other rappers in comparison are fiery and raging while he is reserved and has no enthusiasm for the challenging macho strut. In the final throwdown he is outclassed by everyone yet still succeeds! Played by the right actor this could have been much better.
This movie is very ordinary, Gully boy has nothing entertaining to offer, which defeats the purpose, actually, this movie only came into the picture because of a successful PR stunt.

Bollywood has a long history of copying the Hollywood movies. So this movie smartly twist the storyline of 8 Miles and used PR agencies to promote.
Time has come to boycott such stuff to protect the original.

reviews.review_title: G***dfaad movie a must watch movie for every gully boy
reviews.content: The movie is really beautifully directed, the best part of the movie it shows the sad reality of our day to day life but regardless the movie is full of "Junoon" haha I forgot this word almost, love the music, love the direction, actually loved everything in the movie, every character is nicely played. Ranveer and Alia acting is deadly, vo kya bolte hai "hard hai bhai" :) I understand this movie could be copy of 8 mile but hey trust me this is very different and can't be compared. In indian cinema it's hard to find a movie with natural acting and nice music and Gully boy is the one. Highly recommended movie!!
Amazing acting by Ranveer and Alia and Siddhanth was a gem!!! Great movie, superb direction by Zoya Akhtar and amazing music.

reviews.review_title: A must watch for every passionate person!
reviews.content: Being a musical drama, at first I had my skepticism. As many films in the past failed to impress me those who belonged to the same genre. But surprisingly that is not the case with this one. Built and crafted around real life circumstances and everyday struggles ; it perfectly found balance between making a fantasy comes true type of story and a portrayal of a real life rapper. Accompanied with a brilliantly done soundtrack that fits so well with the story, it amazes us in every other aspects well. Outstanding performances from every lead actor, well developed characters, and great cinematography made it great altogether! Though in the first portion of the 2nd half slowed down, it catches the rhythm in the end nonetheless. I have a little complaint about the screen time given to Vijay Raj and Sidhant Chaturvedi's characters ; they deserved much more for their characters in my opinion. The emotional touch could have been better with that. Overall a must watch for those people who loves music, especially Rap/Hip-Hop scene in India. And for those people who have passion about anything, this movie will inspire everyone to make their dream true. Everything is possible if you think so. Believe in yourself that's the true moral comes out of it!

I went for Ranveer Singh and I weren't disappointed with his acting skills, seriously he casually steals the show away from anybody else in all his films but this time he got a competitor: Alia, yes she was just fabulous, her acting, dialogue delivery was just top-notch, whenever she's on screen, Ranveer gets only our second sight. Story was straight forward and I expected some twists & turns in the Screenplay which didn't happen and it went as usual normal which made us feel like a documentary of an upcoming rapper.

reviews.review_title: Pathetic Plain movie with No Punch
reviews.content: With High level of expectation from Movie. Went to see this MasterPiece from Zoya Akhter but it was total Crap, seen many flat movies with no story line. Waste of money. Poor story

People aware of the problems in this country
Be it class culture, parents forcing their children etc. Will connect to it definitely .
A big shout for Zoya ,ranveer, Siddhant,alia,divine and all other rappers !
Wastage of time.... & money. Acting of "Entertainer Alia"... Below average.

Watch #GullyBoy for some fantastic performances n for some authentic mumbai locations. Its the story of murad, a slum dweller, who loves to rap. He wants to pursue his dream, but his humble surroundings wont let him. His dad brings home another wife. His mom is devastated. His girlfriend is weirdly over possessive. His best friend is a thief. Yet, our hero succeeds. How? Newcomer #siddhantchaturvedi is excellent. Hope to see more of him. Rating 3.5/5.

reviews.review_title: Life lesson for all Gully Boys !!
reviews.content: If want to see some real life hiccups, some real life struggle by passing all hiccups you should definitely watch this and most importantly you would love this movie if you like raps.Ranveer has marked another benchmark which will be very difficult for ongoing and upcoming actors to break it and with every of his upcoming movies he is getting harder and harder. Ranveer is creating wonders and Alia Bhatt was also excellent in typical girl friend role. Alia was able to pose the real chemistry what director wanted. Kudos to both.All actor were at their best but Siddhant as "MC SHER" was very impressive. Kind of maturity he has shown on screen was exceptional. I think it is difficult to lead the role against a super star like Ranveer but he psoted the impact.Excel entertainment as alway the team of Farhan Akhtar and team director Zoya Akhtar went deep into the subject and took very precise put the story forward and positive way.Once in a while, I felt story was dragging but I was wrong, though I felt they could have done better job to still improve. dont miss this movie if you really like inspirational movies.

This movie is not just another movie, it talks about the struggle, identity and dream. The relation with God was also part of the struggle.The socio-economic profile made the character so deep that after watching the film you would have thought 'Murad' as a poet of the city.The Bard of Mumbai could be found in the ignored art form - namely hip hop.The previous generations would know the millenials better after watching this movie.This movie will strike a mark on your heart. You will not forget the felling of working for your dreams and make your own identity.

Nothing great about the story.
Only Acting cannot make a film good.
Simply overglorification

reviews.review_title: Most nuanced telling of a mind of being an Artist.
reviews.content:
In an interview Ranveer told that, " In Simbba I have to do a lot , but in Gully Boy I have to be." This line gives a very brief definition of Ranveer's character in Gully Boy. There are so many things going on near him and he is reacting.
This film is a celebration of characters, not just talking about leads. One of the best quality I recon of the film is that Joya told us how to be in the shoes of an artist in most authentic way possible. The influences of creativity, yet fighting with all the hurdles.
Murad is so grounded and lost in the horrors of being a mediocre person. That there is very little space of doing his thing, but how pain drove him write rap and chase the dream is the main highlight. That is the biggest highlight of the film. Ranveer is phenomenal as Murad. This film is most nuanced telling of being an artist.
A girl with so many ambition and have little anger issue is our Alia. And this film has the potential to make another spin off of there characters. There are so many characters that needed there own storytelling. That is an achievement.Ya there are parts that I as a viewer questioning that is that really a great film or what? These moments are dragged I think, but due to other brilliance, this can easily be neglected.Music to bahut hard hai hi, I listened every single track except the last one called India 91. And oh my God, this very track is a story in it self, the fusion of classic and hip hop music. I loved this track and it is powerfully shown in the climax.A great film always sets trends , so after watching this film I am gonna use Bohot Hard and Ek Number on daily basis!
Even Kaam Bhari Leaves Us A Mark on us! I am saying that because every single character has to say something! SO MANY SPIN OFF POTENTIALS.

reviews.review_title: Ranveer and Alia nailed it! Apna Time Ayga
reviews.content: Honestly the acting and the songs were amazing, holy Siddhanth sir deserves a salute. Ranveer and Alia carried this movie heavily. Definitely worth the watch but all thought I had higher expectations. It's a one time watch for sure but tracks are bangers fr. Loved it, gotta give a 10/10 for these amazing actors Ranveer, Siddhanth, and Alia.

Ranveer pulled one of the best performance of his career, of which much share goes to his favorite director Zoya who has done a remarkable job of story telling. Performance of Siddhant is unbelievable for a new comer, his delivery seems to be very seasoned, looks like he has covered a lot of ground since his first visibility in 'Life Sahi Hai'. A must watch for Indian Cinema lovers, movie is much more than RAP.

The whole movie is a silent protest. Protest against the society. The society, which never accept the slam's people. The people, who has also dream. Dream to become part of the Society, the Country. "Gully Boy" seeks "Azadi". Azadi from every pain in their life.Ranveer is awesome. Zoya, take a bow. And Javed Akhter, regards Sir.

Zoya Akhtar has done it again. She is definitely among the best filmmakers of the country. The movie is extremely inspirational and entertaining. The performances are amazing. The lead actors are phenomenal, and so are the supporting actors.Ps - All those saying this movie is a copy of 8 miles should know that this movie is based on an actual rappe's life. And a film is not a copy of another if it is of the same genre. Also, they should get their intelligence tested.

reviews.review_title: Something Different with the same old underdog story...
reviews.content:
GULLY BOY - I almost made up my mind to rate this movie 7.9/10 just before the climax. But then something amazing happened which never happened with me before. Ranveer's character starts to sing "APNA TIME AAYEGA" and a small part of the audience in my theater start to clap on the song beat by beat in the rhythm. And although i was not one of them , but i was surely amazed with the fact that how much this movie and particularly that song has connected with the youth of this country. And i decided to rate it a little higher then i was going to.And on that note i would urge every reader to spent some money and watch this movie in theater with as big audience as possible. Because thats the right way to enjoy this film to its full potential. But even if u watch it at home , convince at-least 2-3 friends of yours to watch it with you. because this movie cant be enjoyed properly watching alone.
Now i am not some crazy fan of MUMBAI UNDERGROUND RAP SCENE. But i don't hate it either. So my likeness or dis-likeness of the things in this film are not influenced by that.This movie had a very basic story of a Underdog
chasing his dreams. What made it interesting and different is the Slum Setting, the Rap Scene, the dialogues and most importantly the performances.Zoya Akhtar (the director) and Reema Kagti (who co wrote with Zoya) have a tendency to make movies with deep research and deep understanding about the scenarios of there characters. About Film Industry in LUCK BY CHANCE. About friendship in ZINDAGI NA MILEGI DOBARA. And about rich lifestyle and rich peoples' problem in DIL DHADAKNE DO. But this one is the first time where they were making a movie about something which they must have known nothing about before doing research about it. And they did a fabulous job with it. You will never feel that you are getting a view of the lifestyle of slum from outside. You will always feel that you are there with the characters. Thats some strong Direction and Writing.The dialogues were as great as they could have been. All of It fits perfectly with the setting. The one-liners were superb. You are gonna laugh big times , sometimes on really really awkward occasions. Although i would say the jokes were little lesser in quantity and quality if we compare it to ZINDAGI NA MILEGI DOBARA & DIL DHADAKNE DO. But thats OK , everything doesn't need to be perfect every-time.The chemistry between Ranveer & Alia was amazing. And the intimates scenes were great. In those particular scenes Alia is even better then Ranveer , or you can say she was in more love with Ranveer as compare to the Vice-Versa. In-fact i would very much argue that Alia gave the top performance in this movie among the three leads.But then again how can i forget Siddhant Chaturvedi. As MC Sher he was such a natural performer. From his dialogues to his dressing to his persona , everything about him was just screaming one thing - "SWAG". I think he could have a great career in Bollywood.The songs in the movie never hampers the pace. Doori , Mere Gully Main and Apna Time Aayega had the most entertaining videos.Cinematography deserves a special mention (and Nomination). As the movie looked really sleek and very rich . And thats something really difficult to do if 80% of you movie has a setting of SLUM.Two thing which can be said bad about this movie were FIRST the length and SECOND the fact that Ranveer was playing a character much younger thyen his actual age. i mean from nowhere he looks like a college student. But thats just nitpicking in a really good film.I am happy to see that rapping is finally getting more and more importance in India as an ART.8.2/10ANuP APu KuMaR

2. Bad Screen play

6 Wanna be 8 mileGood thing about the movie.1. Alia Bhatt
