reviews.review_title: Typical Bollywood Masala movie (People have come to terms with accepting anything as a good movie)
reviews.content:
If it claims to show the reality of people living harsh lives , it fails to deliver exactly that.
Movies which depict reality, are far different from this.
If you wish to see reality, Mahanagar a film by Satyajit Ray.
Alia Bhatt's role was too much to believe, there are so many aspects to a life in a slum, it was written from a perspective of a person who feels what the slums look like, but it doesn't show even 1% of it.
Bollywood fails to capture life and the people in it are far away from reality.
There was rarely any good character development of Ranveer and Alia wrt to showing a struggling life.
The main theme of the movie is to depict the characters struggling in life, but it doesn't make the audience feel the Actor has struggled at all.
And Kalki Koechlin part in the movie was just a waste of time and added garbage plots.

Do not look at the awards and ratings of this movie and watch. These are deceptive.
This mushy bollywood buys every award and even pays for good reviews.
Nothing great about this movie. Infact it's below par.
And they gave best lyrics award to gully boy? Cheap! Cheap! Film land politics!!KEESARI DESERVED THE AWARD!!

reviews.review_title: Old wine in new bottle, but tastes refreshingly new
reviews.content:
We love characters who defy all odds to reach their goals, don't we? We pine for characters, who dare challenge their circumstances, inside and outside, question the authorities and establishments and make a name for themselves, don't we? Always, yes always, we root for the underdogs. Yes, we want them to win. We want them to make it big. Gully Boy tells the story of an underdog making it big. We have seen everything that has been told before, we can anticipate the moves that are going to be taken by the characters. It is another underdog story that has been told. So, what is so special about this story to keep you hooked a couple of hours?
If clichés are done right, it offers a wonderful ride. Underdog stories are about journeys, journeys of their daily struggles, journeys that take the character from the shadows to the limelight, journeys that make you a part of their own surroundings and when the depiction of those journeys is to the point it makes the character believable enough to make him/her of blood and bones. Since the movie is about a rapper, the raps weave itself in the storyline. It's the soul of this film. It tells the stories of the have nots, the grassroot people who does not know what the next day is going to bring them, people at crossroads in their life and how circumstances always deter us to stay away from the unexplored making us doubt later if we have missed something great.
The actors did a commendable job. The leads, the side characters, blend with the storyline perfectly. The climax feels a bit rushed and highly predictable, but it's the spirit of the film, the raps and our innate nature, which always wants the underdog to win complements for that. And last but not the least, the film has shown the emerging scene of rap in our country. It has succeeded in bringing it to the masses, which otherwise, was limited to certain connoisseurs of the genre only.

Gully Boy is that Bollywood movie which we can only dream of. The story and making is so fresh. Gully Boy is perfect in every department and maybe the best ever in each department. Zoya Akhtar hits it out of the park again after Zindagi Na Milegi Dobaara. The movie is so inspirational and at the end, we will be in tears not just for Ranveer but every single character in the movie. Gully Boy also show casts Muslim women like Bollywood has never shown before. Music is the heart of the movie and they did an excellent job not just in rap songs but other musics here and there. Cinematography captures streets of Mumbai like never before. The casting was perfect and anyone would give full marks. Every single actor did a very good job. Gully Boy is one of the best hindi movie made in recent times.

As a tennis player, this movie inspired me greatly to follow and achieve my dreams.
#Duniyakebolneseghantafaraknahipadta.
#Apnatimeaayega

My biggest issue with this film is Ranveer's rapping and singing. It made the film very very unbelievable. In the scenes where they are having rap battles between various rappers, Ranveer's singing/rapping was the worst. So it made the plot very unbelievable for me. That said - the film is not bad and worth watching.

The focus of the film is Ranveer's character. There are some detours into the city and slum life of Mumbai. I found that part good. Ranveer acted well. But I could just not get over how awful his rapping was. I found it misleading to represent the rap scene using Ranveer's voice. I also found the crowd applauses very artificial and overall I found that the film has a protagonist who is to possess an innate art. However, i found his voice and style lacking. I didn't hate the film. In fact I think it is a difficult film that had its strong moments. It is not a fun film. It is entertaining. But the real-element was missing for me. Overall, this film was a bit of a disappointment.
Each and every character in the movie shines ! Be it ranveer , Alia , Sher , Vijay loved all of them . Songs are the backbone of this movie !

reviews.review_title: All Hail the Consummate Actor i.e Ranveer Singh!!!
reviews.content:
'Gully Boy' is a movie which will last for the ages, it is going to be a cult classic and its impact will be huge in the long run. I could just rave on and on about it, It is that good. Everyone in the movie is spectacular, it is a fantastic cast. Ranveer Singh is just spectacularly versatile, Alia Bhat is Fiery, Siddhant Chaturvedi is pure-awesome, Vijay Verma is brilliant and Vijay Raaz is magnificent.
On the surface, it's a musical drama but it has so many layers that are revealed over the length of the movie. An inspiring underdog story, A refreshingly mature love story which is going to establish a lot of relationship goals, A rousing coming of age story, A mentor-student relationship unlike anything else, True friendships which last for life, Music which is fiercely independent (like a volcano which spits fire) and The central theme which resonates throughout the movie 'Apna Time Aayega'.
Ranveer Singh is hands-down the soul of this movie, His 'Murad' is a protagonist that works relentlessly hard to beat all odds and achieve his dream. His story is inspiring and it made me root for him throughout the movie. I cannot describe just how moving his performance was. I was in pure awe of his versatility and talent throughout and just wanted to bow down to his talent.
'Murad's' journey aided by the powerful music, his voice, his friends, his family amd his love is so rousing that I was completely charged and was just brimming with a restless energy by the end, The final performance of 'Apna Time Aayega' was the perfect culmination, just perfect.
Zoya Akhtar has created a one of a kind masterpiece with 'Gully Boy'. The movie is one indulgent experience, a perfect harmony of craft, execution and heart. The music, The writing, The direction and The cinematography (Mumbai has never been shown like this anywhere, it was just spectacular) just engulfed me. I loved every second of this movie even though it was on the longer side but I wouldn't want to change anything if I had the power to do so.

I want to applaud the makers here for choosing such brave and fresh content. Zoya Akhtar and Reema Kagti have done a fantastic job in writing the movie. To make a movie on a budding rapper residing in the bylanes of dharavi slum in mumbai, there was always a chance that the movie may not connect with all. But be rest assured, this movie is gripping and infact makes you fall in love with rapping.
First and foremost, the setting feels extremely real and authentic, Jay Oza's cinematography must be applauded here. The characters are real, these are people we see around us everyday. Hence, the movie connects very easily with all.
Ranveer Singh is on a roll! Padmaavat's Khilji to playing to the gallery in Simmba and then this! He's having the time of his life. He plays Murad with such rawness, vulnerability and earnestness you completely forget who you're watching on screen. Furthermore, add to this his rapping. This is arguably his best performance according to me.
Alia Bhatt has limited screen time but whenever she is there, she sets the screen on fire. She is hilarious! Vijay Raaz is fantastic as Murad's father. Now coming to the find of the movie, Siddhant Chaturvedi as MC Sher, based on Divine's character. Siddhant owns his character right from the time he appears on screen. In some of his scenes, he almost steals the thunder from Ranveer. That goes on to say a lot. Definitely, an actor to watch out for in future.
Another big factor is music. The songs hit it absolutely out of the park. Each and every song is special in it's way and keeps the movie flowing. Zoya Akhtar also uses some of her father, Javed Akhtar's poems in the movie, doorie and ek hi raasta mesmerizingly.
The movie doesn't have any downsides as such, but it probably goes on for 10 mins too long. But even that is a bit of nitpicking.
Go and watch gully boy. A film like this doesn't get made in bollywood everyday.

I have always criticized Akhtar's heavy handed portrayal of simple narratives and her "over the top" character play. But Gully Boy is a complete overhaul from whatever she has done until now. This film is way more nuanced and raw. Yet there is that quintessential Akhtar Family's poetic touch in the film. The whole film unravels itself as one giant ballad.Writing is mind-shatteringly good. It is quite rare in Indian cinema to see a film which has right amount of drama, emotions and rawness (along with that Bollywood charm of course). There are very few writers out there who can mix all these properly. Kagti and Akhtar are, as they have proved time and again.Each and every character has been crafted meticulously. If one just picks up a character and follows his (sole) journey throughout the film, it might be a story on its own. Though this level of character design is quite common in Western Cinema, but Bollywood still relies heavily on "heroism" of an individual, rather than creating an ensemble. This film though breaks that stereotype.
The acting and casting is on point. Kudos to the team. Though I am still not sure, what should I expect Ranveer Singh's character's age to be (I know he is supposed to be 20 something but he doesn't look like that). Otherwise the whole cast has done a great job.The cinematography was nothing unique but was more than enough to not get in the way of the great storytelling. And the music is surely going to be Awards Season favourites.This film is simply revolutionary, just like what Hip Hop is all about.

The writing, the emotions, the brilliance, every song, every spectacular dialogue, the brilliantly conveyed social message, ranveer singh and all the other actors, the cast, the crew and finally the film, is simply MIND-BLOWING!
there will be no one who has faced tough situations in their life are are struggling to pursue and reach their goals, for all of you guys this film is actually dedicated to!it just carries you away to the small gullys of the mumbai city and really makes you think about all the life choices and difficulties you have faced, and the raps the songs especially " APNA TIME AAYEGA " makes you feel motivated to the core of your very own heart and drives you crazy with extravalent goosebumps on your spine!
no one should really miss this film, it is such a great film,it enriches and nourishes one's view and their life about blossoming out of the great difficulties!

Without fixing the under privileged population in a country, it can never prosper. All the activities happening inside a country i.e. world is connected with each other. They all are causes and effects.
No person should be disrespected just because of their profession. People should be characterized by their character only.
And just because one has achieved less in their career/profession, that doesn't also directly mean they have done/tried less than you to achieve such. The privilege/support one got from his family or other surroundings , all that matters as an X factor in everyone's life!
So, people who accomplished less in life, they must not be directly dis-respected just looking at their achievement in life. It needs to be kept in mind that - everyone has their own story and own x factor of privilege.
But, in practice we must value the expert people for well accomplishment of necessary day to day current activities, but just keep in mind that others who couldn't achieve the standard feat even like the average(your percieved), they should not be plainly disrespected just because they couldn't match the standard for whatever reason. We all are part of the system. Compassion is the key to well being the world!

There is that one movie that takes the actor from very good to special. After that, you watch every movie of that actor with a starry eyed awe and hoping they would just reproduce time and again what they did. It was 3 idiots for Aamir, Rockstar for Ranbir Kapoor and it is Gully Boy for Ranveer Singh. Ranveer doesn't miss a beat throughout. Alia Bhatt is good as usual and rest of the cast supports well. I haven't seen 8 miles but heard this is similar. Even if they picked the concept, this still has to be one of the most refreshing stories ever told in the Indian context. The movie is an entertainer so does follow the popular script of triumph of the underdog; but make no mistake; the movie is deep !! It touches so many aspects; the divide in classes, the dysfunctional joint family, the simple dream to be normal, the ambition to stand out; all beautifully knit in the screenplay. A bollywood movie that stands out of the crowd !
Alia and Ranveer both were phenomenal, every other character in the movie were very well placed and everyone did a good job. Thoroughly enjoyed the movie.
Apart from brilliant acting by Vijay Raaz and Alia Bhatt, nothing really warrants it to be watched again.

reviews.review_title: THE TIME COMES... ALONG WITH CUSHDY FILM
reviews.content:
GULLY BOY REVIEW :-Gully Boy was a thing to watch out for, from it's very first trailer. The songs added some extra boost to make the Excitement level higher and the Final Product DOES NOT DISAPPOINT AT ALL ! Finally, Zoya Akhtar makes a Film with Logic as well as Entertainment. Gully Boy will go down in memory as Zoya Akhtar's Most Entertaining and Appealing film till date. Gully Boy is a Winner from each and every aspect, hence the Box Office Success and Love from Audience is Gauranteed.
The Best thing about Gully Boy is, it never goes illogical, Boring or too much intellectual (which was a problem with some previous films of the same director) yet it manages to pull off the enough conviction. Zoya Akhtar goes to the core of small things of the Characters, for instance the Language, the Swag, The Local Humour, The High-Five, Emotional Connect etc. Gully Boy has it's own zone of storytelling, which is curved towards the Realistic Lifestyle of Characters, thier accent with Local Flavour of Mumbai. Ranveer Singh nails as Muraad, not to speak more but he is probably the Contendar of every Award Show Nominees list. Aliaa Bhatt is Fearless and you'll love her on screen. Every member of Cast lives the Character, with special mention to Siddhant Chaturvedi as Sher. Music is Top Notch and certainly the Biggest USP of the film. The Raps will make you groove on it, especially the Lyrics will hit your hearts. Cinematography speaks through it's angle, the Slums, the Club looks realistic even though most of them are shot with Deam light.
Overall, Gully Boy is a Treat to watch, especially for Rap and Music Lovers. It doesn't really miss anything as all factors like Acting, Script, Screenplay, Music, Direction hits the bar by enough Margin. Gully Boy miss out Quality in few scenes, nevertheless it is still a Winner like i said before. Nothing is more pleasing when you see, Zoya Akhtar arrives in a Proper Commercial Entertainer Zone without losing her Content.RATING - 7/10*
The worst movie i have ever seen in my entire life

Gully Boy, has received a large dose of publicity and its PR teams are in overdrive mode via print media and social media about how wonderful this film is and why youth must watch it.Beneath this large smokescreen is the ugly truth - that Zoya Akhtar's Gully Boy, is an Indianized copy of the 2002 Hollywood film, 8 Mile, based on the famous hip-hop rapper Eminem's life and the backdrop has been cleverly changed to suit Indian audiences so that there is an Indian connect for the audience in semi --urban areas to down right villages.For people like us who have watched 8 Mile, this movie is an abomination in terms of creativity (even if it is inspired from the original! Blatant rip off is the right word, though) is quite a mediocre film spun around "Muslim Ghettoes of Mumbai".Gully Boy should be watched on TV when there is nothing else to do...or if you have some energy left, just grab a Blu-Ray of 8 MILE and let yourself immerse in the wonder that the original Hollywood movie is!!!!Three stars for Alia's performance...rest is just unbearable :(This sort of movie is for those who just want to spend some time in a Mall and nothing much to do...not enjoyable cinema in any sense. Its a shame Zoya Akhtar has come to the usual COPY and PASTE route of bollywood industry.RIP Indian Cinema

reviews.review_title: A gritty tale on Mumbai rappers.....
reviews.content: "Gully Boy" explores a new genre for Indian Movies, and perhaps for the first time the life of an aspiring rapper from a slum of Dharavi has been covered on the screen. Please don't be mistaken, it's not "8 Mile." It carries a story of its own which hits the emotional chord yet remains witty at times. Ranvir Singh plays the title role of a 22 year old living in a slum of Mumbai with an abusive father and needs to overcome the obstacles to give wing to his dreams, with him suitably cast in the role. Supporting is a short but a beautiful role of Alia Bhatt. Apart its gritty look, the film succeeds to grip and hold your attention yet avoiding preachiness; and overall it's entertaining and doesn't give a time to blink. So here is a likable, if not a brilliant film, to start the year with.Rating: 2.5 stars out of 4

Gully Boy merges into you and makes you feel as a part of Murad's journey (Ranveer Singh). Dharavi 17 is where he stays and his daily struggles,his exposure to rap, his love life, a mistake in relationship,his guide,his well-wisher,his bonding with parents.. A common man's journey actually. We all have such stories in our life. Zoya has brilliantly captured the gully life here and shows how it moulds oneself with the amount of time you spend with people around you.With every movie this guy gets better.So once again Ranveer does his one of career's best. Alia is the show stealer with dialogues that gets the whistle. We have three supporting Vijays here in this movie Vijay Raaz(father),Vijay Maurya(Uncle),Vijay Varma(Friend) and they are spot on. Amruta Subash(mother) expresses her life's melancholy brilliantly.Kalki as sky gets limited screen time but packs a punch and last but not the least the game changer Siddhant Chaturvedi(MC Sher). He overpowers Ranveer in many scenes.I won't stop if I start mentioning how apt and brilliant is the screenplay here.. Cinematography by Jay Oza and crisp editing by Nitin Baid are felt on the screen as the movie even being slow in pace doesn't be a boring affair in 2 hrs 35 mins. Zoya has struck a win win here.Finally, what made it more lively was screen time for real life rappers like Emiway Bantaai,Stony Psycho and Dope Daddy from Dopedealicz , Kaambhaari and also a second of Brodha V.Just felt like saying this that how well the hip hop culture has been able to connect with our generation. Emiway Bantaai's one second presence in first half and the crowd erupted like never seen before. Also , his acts in second half are treat to watch. Not to forget Kaam Bhaari is there too.All in all 9/10 from my side. Go for it folks. Watch it for a beautiful journey of the guy from streets.

In my opinion, this is one of the best movies of this decade. Wonderfully crafted, directed and acted. Zoya Akhtar really knows how to bring out performances. The Rap and music was out of this world ('Doorie poem' being my favorite). Absolute genius stuff. Kudos to the team.

Its about a young boy Murad who struggles to establish himself as a rap star. He belongs to a Muslim family, has family issues, has personal issues. All these are finely shown.Alia bhatt and Ranveer Singh is exact to the role. Other casts are well also. The lyrics are exciting and are appropiate to the traits and environment of the protagony. The rap war is awesome. The talent, the presentation, the realism is gripping. The movie has some real characters pinpointing the struggles of lower classes in progressive society. It also shows finely the fusion of western hippy culture with conservative Muslim society with a paint of Indianess alongside it. An impressive work.Alia bhatt is genuine to her role. The reality of muslim household regarding freedom to women is well shown. Ranbeer performance sometimes falls flat in statement delivery but its negligible. The direction and casts are very impressive. The movie gives the message of following the hearts call due to which I think it's a movie of optimism.It has an international appeal. The movie was selected as Oscar nomination where many criticized it. I don't think its wrong. It deserves as nominee by the standards of its theme and narrations. A modern musical film from Bollywood. Zoya Akhtar proved definitely to be one of the best female directors of India. Kudos to the talents of the Akhtar family. A straight 97/100.

reviews.review_title: "Gully Boy" is a masterpiece movie inspired by the real life experiences of rappers Divine and Naezy
reviews.content: "Gully Boy" is the best movie from the movie industry in India so far this year (and it is just February right now ). If you enjoy watching movies based on and / or inspired by the real life struggles of successful people who exist in this world, then you will love this movie and agree with my opinions also.Ranveer Singh gives the best performance of his career so far in this masterpiece movie titled "Gully Boy". However, I must admit, Sidhaant Chaturvedi definitely gave him tough competition in the movie in the role of M C Sher - his mentor / rap-collaborator / music partner. Alia Bhatt was good in her role, and so were the supporting cast such as Vijay Raaz, Vijay Varma and so on.Zoya Akhtar proves once again that she is a brilliant movie-director, actually one of the very best. Farhan Akhtar is clearly the best-young producer alive in India - Farhan Bhai, you rock man - always keep producing outstanding movies like this. Once again, I have to bring up Ranveer Singh's name again - this is because Ranveer has put his heart and soul in this career-best performance in and as "Gully Boy". Keep doing more realistic roles such as this one, brother. You shined brightly in this movie, and I hope and pray that you continue to do so.

reviews.review_title: An inspirational movie about the growing rap culture in India!
reviews.content: The story is based in the slums of Dharavi in Mumbai where a young guy Murad (Ranveer Singh), an aspiring rap artist struggles hard to make it big on the Indian rap stage! The film has a very subtle screenplay paired with a beautifully woven script. The music is the vital factor in the film consisting of many foot-tapping rythmic beats & is a delight for music fanatics! The track "Apna time aayega" will have you groove to its catchy lyrics and pulsating beats! All the actors have performed instinctively and given their best. Especially Ranveer Singh who shows his versatility & amazing rap skills, Alia Bhat as the hot-tempered posessive lover & Vijay Raaz for his intense performance. The rap battles in the film could have been more finely displayed with more complex hip-hop lyrics & that's where the film loses some points. Also the length of the film, particularly the first half could have been cut down a bit. Overall this movie is very heartwarming & is a great inspirational watch!

reviews.review_title: It hits your souls hard. "Bhot Hard! Bhot Hard!"
reviews.content: Gully Boy 2019 - Zoya Akhtar has done it again! Setting the story in rooted realism of our non-fortunate society, showing us thru the lens of their lives, this film about struggle, social class, art, passion, family, love, life and most importantly self identity is one of the most realistic films out there in Indian cinema; Reema Kagti and Zoya Akhtar has done once again terrific job in writing, flushing the characters, giving them time. Every scene and actor has a purpose in this film; Every actor, technician, production in the film is phenomenal! Ranveer Singh, Vijay Raaz, Alia Bhatt are terrific! Siddhant, Vijay Verma entire supporting cast just disappears in the characters! The metaphors, sometimes straight to the point dialogues, words and symbolism are poetic and simply Devine! Music, words, lyrics are the spine of this struggle and they are razor sharp truths, cuts our heart and enters thru it! Hats off!PS - It teaches us something, makes us reflect our world, speaks to the soul and hits you hard! As Gully Boy would say Bhot Hard! Bhot Hard!This might just be one of the best film made in a decade! Deserving recognition around the world and makes me feel proud that this kind of films are and will be made in my country! Don't miss it please!! Watch it! It deserves our time and money, there are only few such films out there.

reviews.review_title: A sincere and convincing film by Zoya Akhtar & Reema Kagti!
reviews.content: Gully boy is a realistically-presented film with characters you can relate to and connect with. It reintroduced Rap singing in Hindi cinema, which had gone out-of-vogue long time back.The film's basic storyline of a poor fellow going on to achieve something BIG because of his PASSION, is absolutely real. There are many examples in the world to prove that.Loved the songs, "Apna Time Aayega" & "Mere Gully Mein"!Ranveer Singh as Murad, maintained his slum boy image throughout the film, without being "show offish" in any way. Alia Bhat as Safeena is a frank, assertive and "muh-phat" girlfriend of Murad; but she is emotional too. Siddhant Chaturvedi's portrayal of rap artist MC Sher (and guru to Murad), as well as, his very convincing Mumbaiya Hindi accent and style is worth watching a few times.

reviews.review_title: The theme of the movie "Overcoming challenge against colossal odds" is a universal phenomena, its too generic to be termed "inspired"- this film is just a tribute to te theme.
reviews.content: Gully Boy tells the inspirational story of an underdog without creating a victim out of his socio-political circumstances.The director focuses on the protagonist's challenging journey instead of making it about his communal identity and thereafter, builds the story around that- one man's fight against the odds which is a theme most of us can correlate with in many ways.I am not a fan of musicals or dance films, but this one had more to it than just baseless songs and mindless dance sequences... it had a gigantic story with a universal message...Here circumstance, not ideologies, for a change, is depicted as the real villain.This kind of story telling, helps "polarized" people understand and accept the other side of the divide. On either side of the ideological divide, we are people at the end of the day.Movies like Mulk, series like Leila, point a few out as villains exaggerate things about them and demonize them, and further the socio-cultural rift by such polarization...Gully Boy on the other hand, flips the perception upside down, presents it as a more universal underdog story, creates a sense of empathy for the protagonist, in a very subtle manner furthers the idea of inclusion and most people love it.
First the plot and the story attracts me, but when I saw the cover, it makes me change my mind....to be honest I would watch it,if alia wasn't cast in it.....

Ranveer Singh has done it perfectly plus Shiddhant seem realistic. His performance represents the quality of work and hard work.From the beginning movie entertains you and makes you realise how you have been ? And motivates whatever you ad been...Bollywood's one of the Golden.

Gully Boy is the quintessential movie about the underdog overcoming all obstacles to win on the big stage. We have seen plenty of such movies before, both in Hollywood and Bollywood. But what elevates Gully Boy from the average is the way it has been written and directed. Zoya Akhtar has used a skillful mix of entertainment and messaging. There are hundreds of little things in the film that ring so true and you can easily empathise with. Gully Boy is the nickname of the rapper Murad Ahmed (Ranveer Singh) who emerges from the bowels of Dharavi, the world's biggest slum, to bag the big prize. Along the way he and his girlfriend Safina (Aila Bhat) smash many myths without getting overly preachy. The rap sequences, and there are plenty of them, are the best parts of the film. Energetically shot, they mince no words in pitting the haves against the have-nots. The subliminal messaging is obvious. "Apna Time Aayega" (Our Time Will Come) has the potential to become an anthem of the underdog in the election year. Ranveer Singh underplays Gully Boy and brings a terrific touch of hurt and melancholy to the character. Aila Bhat sizzles as Gully Boy's girlfriend and aspiring surgeon. The movie liberally uses the street slang of Mumbai. Zoya Akhtar has packed a punch in Gully Boy. Don't miss it.

The movie has got no hot item numbers, action scenes and unsensible indian comedy, yet it has got a life into it, addressing the problems of youth of the lower and lower middle class, this movie is a gem in itself, a true motivation for everyone.
The scripting is beautifully done, everything from the location to the costume, to the cast is just perfect. The script demanded more of realistic acting and the caste was able to do it,
Kuddos to zoya akhtar for this wonderful creation of art.
A must watch

I used to think that Ranveer has delivered his career best in Padmavat, but no, I was wrong.. his career best was yet to come and it has finally arrived in form of "Gully Boy".
But before getting on the performances, first starting with the movie.
They are very few movies which inject an energy blast in you and make you someone different as you step out of the movie theatre. Gully Boy is one of this kind, it enters in your mind first and then it captures your heart and then, you are all cheering Ranveer Singh, rapping on the stage. The movie and the rap seem to be so real that you could feel the energy, thrill, and zeal of it. You find yourself one among the audience and you just want to cheer Ranveer Singh aka Gully Boy to increase his adrenaline, so he can deliver his best rap performance.Zoya Akhtar put the soul to the movie with her flawless and impeccable direction. She carries the movie in such a realistic way that it makes you think that all the character and incidents are real and you are right there and watching them.But the spirit of "Gully Boy" lies in its character and their marvelous performance. As, I started with Ranveer Singh, who has undoubtedly delivered his career-best makes you forget the ups and downs of your life with its stubbornness, zeal, energy level and electrify raps. Alia Bhatt as we all know is a wonderful actress has once again proved that she is the leading lady of Bollywood, in such a short span of her career in the film industry, she has stunned us with so many amazing performances. In Gully Boy too, she has once again impressed and entertained us with her impeccable dialogue delivery and facial expression. She is just awesome. After the leading pair, another character who has left his mark in the movie is the debutant "Siddhant Chaturvedi" the young atom bomb. He played his character to the utmost point and leaves us praising and cheering form him while watching the movie. He is undoubtedly the next vVcky Kaushal of Bollywood. Great debut by him. Rest all the support cast was good.The last but and least, the thing without that this movie cannot be completed is its raps. The raps are so good, much much better than Honey Singh and Badshah. I wonder how talented people are. The lyrics and the music both are so awesome and electrifying that they take a fiery and zestful you out of you.So. at last I want to say that "Gully Boy" is one of the movies which will entertain you, make you think, will groove you with its music and stunned you with the power-packed performances involved.In short, if you want to see something real and different, do not wait, just head towards the cinema hall.

"Kya bolti public? Bohot-icchh hard movie banaili Zoya bibi ne. Dil ko rulaya, asli hip hop se milaya aur apun ko rap ka fan banaya."Gully Boy is probably one of the finest films coming from Bollywood. It's loosely based on the lives of rappers Divine and Naezy and is a story of an underdog who dreams big kyuki 'apna time ayega'.Murad played by Ranveer is a boy who lives in the slums of Mumbai and writes poetry. He is in a beautiful love story with a feisty Safeena, an aspiring doctor played by Alia. Then there is the character of MC Sher played by Siddhant, an underground rapper who takes Murad under his wings and mentors him, guiding him in the art of rap battles. Murad lives a hard life plagued by poverty where in his father puts in money into his education so that he can get a white collar job. Then there is the conflict in his family. And you can clearly see he doesn't get along well with his father played by a brilliant Vijay Raaz. The film beautifully narrates Murad's journey into discovering himself and going on and becoming successful despite all the hardships he faces.The film is two and a half hours long but never feels like it. The magic that Zoya weaves on the camera is amazeballs. The central character might be Murad but every side character gets a piece of the pie. This is a rarity in Bollywood. Special mention to Siddhant Chaturvedi as MC Sher, what a character. Such brilliance as he goes toe to toe with Ranveer. He is magnanimous. Ranveer baba is in top form. This is the first film where you see his emotions do the bulk of the work. His expressions brilliantly portrays his hardships, his love, his passion. You can't help but root for his character. Alia surprisingly was used very less. But she literally lit up the screen while she was at it. Ekdum dhop-tich wo sabko. Vijay Verma who plays Moin, Murad's friend who does odd criminal jobs also does a brilliant work. We see different levels of their friendship throughout and the final level tears me up. Rest of the star cast too does a mighty fine job and hold the film together never letting it get boring.The cinematography captures the slum life in Mumbai in a oddly beautiful way. Quite a few shots are close ups right in your face engaging you as an audience. The difference in high rises overlooking the slums thus showing the disparity is brilliant. The other highlight of the film has to be its music. Kudos to all the artists who came together to give us an album of a lifetime. An 18 track movie is unheard of in Bollywood. Every song comes with a meaningful scene attached to it and the lyrics match the scene like puzzle pieces. Zoya as a director is brilliant and this has to be her best work till date. Her research on the hip hop culture seems to be near perfect. She along with Reema Kagti have written an amazing screenplay with some astonishing dialouges by Vijay Maurya. The Mumbai ya tapori lingo is so much fun to hear. It stays with you even after the credit rolls come to an end.The movie is not only an underdog story but has a beautiful love story at heart and an ode to the city of Mumbai. The film can be a great motivator to the audience so as to never give up on your dreams no matter who you are or where are you coming from. I'm thankful to Zoya and the team for giving us such a brilliant movie. This one is definitely a must watch and atleast 3 times in a theatre.

reviews.review_title: Gully Boy : Honest review by Ashish Khandelwal
reviews.content:
The Movie... Absolutely Superb!!
And A MUST WATCH . . ..Ranveer ka time aa gya hai and chal bhi raha hai! Everything he touches turns to Gold! Simply do not feel anyone better could have done anything better in any way better than this powerhouse of Bollywood! Having said so, it is not just about Ranveer and appropos to Zoya for not trying to cash in Ranveer's popularity simply for the sake of it..The characters are superbly etched and Zoya Akhtar definitely knows the pulse of her audience very well! Special mention to Alia Bhatt and Siddhant Chaturvedi ( your MC Sher).. absolutely nailed their parts and played parallel leads to perfection. . . .The movie is well paced and I literally could have watched the movie for another two hours!Music, songs, rap - everything is terrific, to the point, soul stirring at times and definitely drives you in!!! From the storytelling to performances everything about the movie was awesome. Mind blowing performances by Ranveer and Alia. But my heart goes out to Siddhant who portrays MC Sher. He totally lives the role and you come out convinced that he is truly a hip hop artist. Not to mention the music.. each song seemed to have a soul to it thanks to the amazing poetry.

This movie is a non-eye blinking movie,none of any scenes will make you feel bore and every song in this movie is at it's right place. It's a must watch movie but they should have done a good song in the end that would have made the ending best.

I was not wrong to watch this a week before my finals, I really must finish watching it.I have this perception about Ranveer.. that his character and spirit are uncontainable. His previous characters like simmba, alaudin khilji, ram rajadi all required high sense of strength and Ranveer is exactly what the characters are: so energetic. But in Gully Boy, he is different. He captured the pain inside of being raisee in slums, to parents who both are at each other's throat, with no money, and worst, being told to stop dreaming because of their reality. I applaud the director and producer who dared to take this context of india to the big screen. Poverty, together with unhygienic conditions of living.. but it didn't stop a boy from achieving his dreams.Apart from Ranveer, Alia Bhatt did a great job too. Feisty, intelligent girl with lots of tricks in mind. Chaturvedi was convincing as a rapper. Koechlin is as carefree as always.Great songs. Not your typical hindi beats but they sounded great. Hoping to see Gully Boy shine at the filmfare awards.

reviews.review_title: Leave '8 Mile'.......watch this......coz its so realistic & INSPIRING !!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.content: So many of my fellow IMDB users are quoting '8Mile' things......saying this as a copy cat.....slow.....etc. etc. But leave that behind....forget Ranveer, Alia and other big names......just go blank into the theater to watch this........I am sure you will come out surprised & super impressed...I can bet !!! coz it's that brilliant. If you love DIVINE, HIP-HOP music and all that then that will be the icing on the cake. Acting were so natural that it didn't look like acting. It's so real. Ranveer scored very high again. But Alia....what an act !!!! Oh just loved her. An entire essay can be written on her performance in this movie!!! Siddhant's also brilliant !!! Only a very few issues, like impact of Murad's writing on his fellow underground rappers at the beginning seems bit obvious. It can be presented more realistically. Though, later the impact of his writing were deeply felt by everyone for sure. Otherwise the movie contains- brilliant portrayal of every character, top notch direction, Hollywood standard camera work, brilliant & hard-hitting sound-tracks........all-in-all an INSPIRING showcase of Gully reality ....HARD HAI...!!!!

There's nothing left for me to say. Ranveer Singh is perfect for his role of Murad and Alia Bhatt is looking classy in her role of Safeena. The Journey of MURAD becoming GULLY BOY is magnificent. How Murad suffers from the people around him always telling him that," A worker's son is bound to be a worker." But how he just follows his path to fulfill his destiny is just a cinematic delight to watch. He also turns to certain paths for money and how he suffers from those consequences is also depicted beautifully. Zoya Akhtar has once again delivered a powerful film.

But the most brilliant performance came from ranveer singh he plays brilliantly his part of Murad nervous yet rebel power pack performance from him He shows his amazing range from khilji to simbaa to gully boy Lyrics is superb location is superb Masterpiece movienofbyear 2019

Murad played by Ranveer Singh loves his mother, brother and granny. His relationship with his father on the other hand is troubled. Beyond the family he has his friends Moeen, Salman and others and his girlfriend Safina played by Aliaa Bhat.
Murad and Safina have been dating for 9 years behind their parents back and things have been going smoothly for them. Until a girl sends Murad - Valentine type messages and the girl gets thulped by Safina. Safina comes from a well off family and is on track to become a doctor like her father. In priorities her education comes first. She's also very snippy and possessive where Murad is concerned. Yet, both are equally supportive of each other's education and ambition.
One day at a college fest a girl singing on stage gets booed off the stage by a couple of boys who comment on how boring she is, not just because of her song but also her looks. The next act in the lineup is MC Sher who takes the mic and starts rapping which is how Murad gets sucked into the underground world of rappers.
Murad takes his daily experiences and pens them down. Every insult, every fight, every moment of happiness, the struggle everything gets penned to form the rap. After his first stage and battle he only gets better and more comfortable with not just who he is but actually putting his heart out for the world to see.
Murad's mentor Sher finds an outlet in rap. He gets his anger and frustration out by singing. His father's an alcoholic and his mother has abandoned them. This is why he constantly tells Murad to vent and not bottle it up.
Shot with Dharavi in the backdrop this movie is definitely about the underdog breaking the wave but the reasons why this movie stood for me are because:
Dharavi is just another location that the protagonist comes from yet there is a scene where foreigners are taken around because that's what they want to see. *Eye Roll* (Which I think was a jab at a certain movie made about slums in India.)
It isn't like Murad has a secret gift that he suddenly unw(raps) one day. He gradually gets better at it and you see the character grow.
The movie is about Murad but all the actors in the movie have done an excellent job and you'll know when you watch.
The story is very real. It isn't one of Zoya Akhtar's destination location wala story. It is closer to reality than any of her other movies.
Watch it if you need motivation. You'll surely get some. All in all to me it was a fun movie. I liked it. Aliaa Bhat was amazing and whether you like rap/hiphop or not you will like this movie if you care for the lyrics.

Watch it for beautiful acting by every bunch of actors in this amazing movie.How to pull of an acting out of an actor Zoya akhtar knows so well.

Fact: I don't like rap, I haven't watch Mile 8.Movie: Watching movie in Slum area is not my thing. I am more into Karan Johar's baby. Seeing a grandeur movie with lot of costumes and all. Ranveer Singh and Zoya brought me to this title. We have to admit that audiences are vary to some extent. There will be saying this movie is crap, boring, masterpiece, Oscan material and such. To justify a movie, you have to watch and endeavour what is served. Gully Boy served a multilayered story focusing on Murad's dream to rap. I can say this is not Zoya's finest, but also not that bad. I realize it will be hard on elaborating background story why Murad loves rap. What happened in first scene is not helping at all. She made hooks in the movie which force us to see who is Murad--and it happened he live in patriarchy family with polygamy issue--which is not elaborate because it is just focus on catching a dream. Safeena and Murad's story is showing the inequality and class divide. There will be a lot pros and cons about this but there are a lot of movies talking about this. Capturing the generation gap without emphasize to Digital India is a smooth way from Zoya. Oh, don't you forget about child labour which is not very advisable to do so. Sky's presence was somehow problematic, but I keen to believe Zoya tried to send a message, sometimes couple need a space from each other. There are many flaws (in my point of view) but it seems won't matter much.Act:
Ranveer Singh is showing another avatar of him which he never put in larger scale. From Bitto Sharma to Murad Ahmad. He's not piling up similar avatar like SRK, but there are down at the pit as well.
Alia Bhatt. She has contribute at minimum level but her portraying Safeena is quite bold and smart. Over protective yet has no gut to tell to her parents. Good job, Safeena.
Siddhant Chaturvedi. This debutant surely know how to work with big star such Ranveer.
Vijay Raaz. Outstanding Father. He is surely another version of Ronit Roy's avatar of Abusive Father/Husband.It is not my favorite genre and scene, so 2 point to deduct.
Ranveer Singh added 4 points.
Alia Bhatt added 2 points.
Rappers added 2 points.
Story is just 1 point for me, it is beautiful, but not in my favor. Dialogue 1 point, so in total 8. A good film is a good film.

So a lot of people at the release of the Ranveer Singh Starrer Gull Boy straight away began comparing to the Eminem Oscar winning 8 Mile. There is no doubt that there are some similarities but calling it a copy is just not correct. It has been said by the director of the film Zoya Aktar that people did compare it to some other films but when the Mumbai rappers who played a major role in the story development and filming of the film had been interviewed, there was many accounts when they mentioned that after seeing 8 Mile they were inspired and motivated to evolve their skill in this art of rapping. So there has been some inspiration from 8 Mile for example the segment where Ranveer's character is participating in a rapping competition, which has similar vibes to the version of the underground rap scene portrayed in 8 Mile. But then again all this is telling us the story of Divine and Neazy who are very up in the Indian rap scene in and outside of India (outside as I follow them event hough I'm living in Australia). So personally it is not a copy of 8 Mile but they do share similar vibes, but personally Gully Boy was able to play with more from the plot and use of music overall personally making Gill Boy the better film when compared to 8 Mile.The acting from all the supporting cast was so genuine you would feel like you are watching a documentary but the people in the documentry do not know that there are cameras everywhere. What I am trying to say is that the performance from the cast was on point.The acting highlights are definitely the performance of Ranveer Singh as the main protagonist, Aliah Bhatt as she yet again showed use how versitile and just natural she can be on intense and bold characters like the one she played in Gully Boy and Udta Pubjab. Others who stole the show in every scene which they were apart of includes the sensational and believable performance of Vijay Raaz, Vijay Varma who is just so talented and the under appreciated performance of Siddhant Chaturvedi who is very close to the character is Ranveer Singh through out the film. And the last supporting cast which I will mention is definitely the performance of the beautiful Kalki Koechlin, she was just a privlidge to watch on the big screen again after seeing her in Scared Games (before writing this I saw the film again and yes I am aware Scared Games season 2 came out after Gully Boy).Overall a must watch as the whole film was amazing as the universe which it creates it is able to portray real life Mumbai really well. Only problem was the ending as I and many others was wanting more by the finishing moments of the film. I say this as literally when the film ended I looked ay my brother and said "they're actually gonna finish it like this". Personally felt like some bigger was gonna happen or like another 5 minutes cincludimg the movie would be placed to end it at a high note but they finished the film in very lack later manner. If it wasn't for the ending this is definitely a perfect film but ending was the only problem.8/10 would definetly recommended.

The only good thing which came out of this movie is the hidden genre of rap in India. A dull, cliched missed opportunity. The typical love story, the typical rags to riches, the typical backlash from elders.

So, authentic this movie feels in it's every frame. All of the zoya akhtar's movie till now has connected with the audience in every possible way. Same holds the true for Ranveer's Gully Boy. Sound editing had to be on the top in a musical drama like Gully boy.
Zoya akhtar has never failed with her work and same happens with the Gully Boy, a must must watch for the everyone who calls them a movie lover, Watch it if you want to see why bollywood has changed and this change is positive.

Yes,that's how much I connected to the Gully Boy !Such movies really lift up the standards of our very own Bollywood and I feel so happy that this kind of cinema is really working here ! #ApnaTimeAayega"Kehne ko hum pass hai par

reviews.review_title: Worth watching but mostly for the music and Alia Bhatt
reviews.content:
I'll begin with a disclaimer. Gully boy is not a bad film, neither is it brilliant. It is a decent commercial film. But the only reason I'm writing a review for it is because I found the film worth analyzing because it could have been so much more despite it getting a few things right.
First of all, and this irked me a lot. Murad's mother is angry about the fact that his father has gotten a new wife. Murad feels empathy for his mother. Later in the film, Murad cheats on his current girlfriend Safeena after spending a fun and liberating night out with Sky. And then he begins to lie to Safeena. Now, psychologically speaking, this does not make any sense. If he feels empathy for his own mother, who is the first, he should feel empathetic towards Safeena who is the first in his life and should go back to her immediately. He would not be able to cheat on her and then lie to her. That isn't how human nature works. It's definitely not take advice from a friend, seeing how casual Sky is with MC Sher as well and Sky rejecting his sense of identity by telling him that it doesn't matter where he is from, when it clearly matters to Murad. And even then it takes Safeena almost forcing him to come back to her by manipulating Salman, before he does come back. This is not to say that the relationship between them isn't one of the highlights of the film. That is the one thing the film gets very accurate and real more than the relationships we've seen on screen. Safeena is a beautiful character essayed perfectly by Alia Bhatt with her manipulative smile and a blink that borders on being a threat.
Another thing, by going into the idea of Doori inspired by a random event with a girl he drives reduced the impact of the song rather than elevate it. It'd have been elevated if it was inspired by his mother, who he is unable to protect despite loving her. Then I would get more of a sense of who Murad is and where he comes from.
Also following up the fight between his mother and father, which was quite intense, with the recording of Mere gully mein is poor structuring. We don't get a sense of what Murad is feeling because he is struggling in his reality at home while he is having fun shooting a music video. This gives a lack of emotional continuity to the character. If the filmmaker intended to show that this is a way out for him from the struggles of life, it does not explain the purpose behind the angst in his lyrics, when music is just a way to get away from problems.
Now let's get to the angst, the angst in the lyrics is rarely replicated in the narrative. We never see him seeking for 'Azadi'. The system is responsible for Murad's condition, but the system is reduced to making us feel just for Vijay Varma's character. The system itself plays no part in Murad's narrative. So his journey is more a search for identity than one riddled with angst and hence the lyrics seem on a completely different tangent from the narrative of the film. Contrast this with the way lyrics and narrative come together in 'Muqqabaaz' as angst against the system and we realize that Gully boy fails to tie those two things.
Now this is not to say that there are no good things in the film. Ranveer Singh's performance is quite restrained and manages to affect you in certain scenes especially him looking into the camera in 'Doorie'. Alia Bhatt is quite charismatic. Vijay Varma dominates all the scenes he is in, especially when he flips at Murad. Siddhant Chaturvedi is cool to the bone, even though his character fades in importance as the narrative goes on and stays just as the initial mentor. Sky is disposable from the narrative. Her character's purpose could have been served by MC Sher himself. She could have been reduced to just an affair. The background score rings even after the film is done and it is definitely one of the music albums of the last couple of years. Especially the Dub Sharma tracks 'Azadi', 'Apna Time aayega' and 'Jingostan'. Divine really steps it up in the songs he has sung. Ranveer's rapping could have been more genuine, though without the accent he is trying to place in there.
The major problems of the film lie in the structure of the screenplay and the edit. Doorie's edit does not work at all and I was praying while going into the film that maybe the video they have released is just for promotion and this is not how the song has been cut in the film, but it turned out to be exactly that way.
The cinematography of Jay Oza is exasperating. At times it is brilliant while at times it just does not fit the event. Especially in 'Apna time aayega' the only thing that elevates the scene is the music. That glitzy gold background om the stage does not help proceedings at all. Though I have to congratulate him on the drone shots of Bombay. I've never seen Bombay shot that way before and those shots really create a visceral effect along with the shot in which Ranveer Singh sits in the car as the party goes on all night.
Some of Zoya Akhtar's choices are really interesting. Like making Murad a really passive character in the beginning, really detached from life, constantly being dragged into situations by the people around him, until he hears MC Sher rap. That's the first time he takes the initiative to do amything. But then he goes back to his passivity and there lies the problem of the structure. It does not just extend the length of the film, but also creates a wall between us understanding Murad. And one important thing in all of this is that if the protagonist is satisfied with his partner and has found solace there, he has also sorted things with his father, why is he ambitious at all, apart from being able to prove to his father and mama that being an artist can bring him out of his circumstances. That is an emotion that won't work because that is not what the film is setting up. The film is setting up the circumstances that Murad is brought up in. So it isn't about escaping those circumstances through momey and fame but doing something that facilitates other people escape those circumstances as well. Here, Zoya Akhtar chooses to make no statements. Not everybody can become an artist and find a way out of those conditions. That is not a viable solution. So, at the end Murad is just somebody who makes his locality proud. But does nothing to change the circumstances that made him who he is and will do the same to many others after him.
It is definitely worth a watch, but fails to live up to the expectations Zoya Akhtar herself had set through her short in 'Lust Stories' and the initial promos of the film.
STORY OF ALL INDIANS WHO GO THROUGH THIS PHASE OF THEIR LIFE

reviews.review_title: A film that doesn't take the audience for granted
reviews.content:
There are three major flaws with the film. And I am not kidding -
1. The underground rap scene of Mumbai/India is not greatly popular. Beyond niche audience people are unaware of even the two pioneering characters who have inspired the story. This makes the characters less relatable.
2. The music itself is repetitive and isn't rising. There is no obvious way of understanding why one rap is better than the other. The wordings are hugely meaningful, the beats are basic and even the much hyped rap number, "Apna time ayega" is paean to wistful thinking and not to the blood sweat tearful grit of everyday existence.
3. And the last major problem, the graph or narrative of the film is winner-takes-all sports drama. This is so dumbed down version of any reality that it is problematic that directors are still using this trope. Even after all the success in life, there is the next day, the next project, the next failure, winnings and winners are just momentary. Think of the American Idol 17 winner, after 15 minutes of fame and holding the trophy above your head, American Idol 18 auditions are already on.
Now these major flaws out of the way, there are six things which work for the film and how!
1. Cinematography. It is a major win for the film to use the real location, aerial shots and all the lowliness and glory of Mumbai/Dharavi-17. Kudos! However, the major win is the beautiful frames through its entire runtime. The film deserved all awards in this category.
2. Dialogue. Everything in the film sound improvised except a couple of dialogues by Alia Bhatt and Vijay Raj's cribbing about Ranveer eating a lot of food and wasting money for his education. This is significant. It is almost unbelievably great. Vijay Maurya deserves every possible awards in the category.
3. Direction. And Art Direction by Farhan Akhtar and Ritesh Sidhwani. So when a director gets a script, or in this case co-writes a script, nothing is there to begin with except (in this case) a good story. She has to imagine every single thing to the last detail to make the story come alive in the film. This is an extremely daunting process if there is no benchmark. Zoya Akhtar introduces a sub-genre to Bollywood film and deftly avoid all possible Bollywood genres that the movie could seek to fit in - drama, biography, documentary, experimental, musical, coming-of-the-age. Instead she chooses an yet unexplored for Bollywood sub-genre called "Hood films". The sub-genre is defined by discrimination, crime, broken families, drugs, Rap culture. Societal/moral/financial upliftment is not the ultimate goal of the films in this genre. The goal is always to tell the story of the marginalized. And Zoya veers into this unfamiliar territory (both for her and the audience) and stay true.
4. Editing. Of course, you can't see good editing, you see the final product and have no counterfactual data on how what-is-kept compares to what-is-not-kept. Bad editing is often easily visible. If you come out of theater feeling it could have been 30 minutes shorter, the film is most likely badly edited. The great thing about this film is that it could have been more tightly edited, at least a few scenes could have been shortened, especially some of the scenes where Kalki is in, some of the scenes where Alia is in, some of the scenes where Siddhant is in. I am not talking about cutting the story arcs, just cutting scenes to make the film tighter. But the editor does not do so. Why? You can justify it by saying fleshing out characters, having emotional breathing space and so on. But my guess is the editor wanted the cinematography to shine, why? It was clear to Nitin Baid (editor) that the audience is largely unfamiliar with the music scene and its practitioners, the first touch point with relatability lies with the city and the characters. The editing is slack to accommodate the audiences involvement with the situation rather than the underlying music. I am saying if it is a sports movie about Indian Rugby, and the audience has no clue what the game is, the editor has to create a space so that you can identify with the context where these Rugby players are coming from. Else you need to explain Rugby rules a la Aamir Khan's Dangal.
5. Casting. I mean what a great casting. You see these same set of actors acting in all Hindi films, right? So why would you, as an audience, believe Ranveer is Murad and not Alauddin Khilji, especially if you loved him so much in that role? This is where the casting crew comes in. They have to visualize that the same actor has played very different roles will fit in as a rapper with street-credence. This is NOT same as casting Shahrukh, Salman, Hrithik and other "superstars". Superstars in Hindi films generally reprise the same character in various guises and bring the same charisma/charm to the screen. SRK practically acts the same role in all his films. This is similar to the difference in singing between Vishal Dadlani and Arijit Singh. Vishal in his many songs sings the same range, maintains the same texture and poor Arijit has to revisit his repertoire and bring something different every time. The casting for this film is great. Again, it should win all awards in the category.
6. Acting. OF COURSE. Right? Acting is undeniably great. But, there is a but. Ranveer Singh, who is really effective, is not the best actor in the film. Far ahead is Alia Bhatt, and Siddhant Chaturvedi. Why? Because many of their reactions to the scenes come as unexpected. There is a scene inside a darkened train compartment, present among four other people, where Alia just repeats being called, "tod-fod" (or something like that). And then she stands up to leave with Ranveer. Nothing else happens in that scene. But her expressions come across as puzzling and fresh. This is repeated in at least 2-3 more times in the film, for example Alia crying and pleading to her father to continue her studies. And for Siddhant, he is marvelous. He deserves the best debutante award in all award shows. Finally, how good is Ranveer Singh? There is a small issue with his portrayal. At least a few times he breaks character of being coy, shy, underdog and shows his "hero"/"star" side. For example, his climbing wall to enter Alia's home is extremely cliched hero-like. Ranveer, at the pick of his game, should have insisted in skipping these things. There are at least 2-3 more that doesn't suit the character arc and extremely convenient/lazy story telling.I have this theory, no good film ever declares in the course of the film, that it is good or its characters are great and to be lauded for being so. Like the first scene of Manikarnika, Rani Laxmi Bai is already a hero, just born as a child and blessed to be as great as Rama, in the next scene she is hunting tiger right in the middle of a jump. Only a rubbish film demands that you, as an audience, accept the character's greatness from the opening scene. This is akin to taking the audience for granted."Gully Boy" would not take you for granted through its 2 hour 30 minutes running time even for once. It passes Bechdel test when Alia talks to her mom about the act of lying. It tests your intelligence when you feel torn about a character that uses children as drugs carriers and can't suitably take one position or the other (also about Ranveer stealing cars). It mesmerizes you with cinematography. It introduces a sub-genre to mainstream Bollywood and stays true to it. And finally, it tells a human story full of different shades of gray and stays true to the struggle of the daily existence.I give this film a 9 out of 10. The 1 mark is deducted is for a few unwarranted herogiri that was introduced in Ranveer's character. Exchange on note-taking in the class, entering Alia's home through toilet window, etc which were lazy.PS: The best scene in the film is where Kalki asks if Ranveer and Siddhant have a contract with some label. Awesome!

reviews.review_title: Actors and screenplay (not script) nailed it.

Easily one of the best hindi movies I've watched till date. In Gully boy , Zoya Akhtar beautifully portrays the story of an up and coming rapper from the streets of Mumbai, whilst also showing the cultural and societal problems faced by people in India. Ranveer Singh and Alia bhatt both deliver strong performances, with this being imo Ranveers best ever on screen performance. All scenes in this movie are relevant and organically tie together to build a superbly executed story. So, in conclusion Gully Boy is a very inspiring movie with amazing dialogues, raps and superb performances by the entire cast. Ignore the trolls writing that this is a rip off of 8 miles,... they clearly haven't seen either movies :)

Director of Photography creates magic with precise arial shots over the Mumbai Slums. A lot of stunts in "Meri Gully Mein", designed by Bosco-Ceaser were marvelous and jaw dropping. Some of them were so fluent didnt seem real, if it wasent then commends the handling by VFX Team.
The movie mostly stands out in its dialogues with all the Tapori Dialogues failing to catch sometimes but keeps you entertained throughout.
But with dialogues limited, the film was most about expressions by Ranveer and Alia. The stellar performance by award winners of 2018, winning hearts again this year. The support cast by Kalki, Siddhant, Vijay Raaz, Vijay Verma on pars with the lead of the film.
The story seems a lot more predictable, plots unneeded, actions unjustified, and 150 mins long movie.
The direction of the movie was great as the movie justified Murad's story with other characters in his circle. The story showed the true feminism with Alia Bhatt's continuation of her studies. The story sewed to show how relationship of Murad stands out with all the people in his cirle of friends, mentor, affair, girlfriend, family with abusive father, etc. The cliffhanger by Zoya Akhtar was the best part in the film yet she discloses the suspense very next second.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies of the decade
reviews.content: Should you compromise with your dreams just because your present circumstances do not allow you to pursue your dreams? Zoya Akhtar answers the question with a solid No. Gully boy, for me is one of the few Bollywood movies that combine craft with wholesome entertainment. Everything , the acting performances, the dialogues , the cinematography portraying the Mumbai as seen from the eyes of a struggling rapper, the story lines is exceptionally done.The reason Gully boy works is because the emphasis it plays on every character of the movie. Sure, it is the story of Murad played marvellously by Ranveer Singh, but the supporting characters have their own stories which are never sidelined in the movie. The love story between Safeena and Murad ( Alia and Ranveer) is unique and the chemistry is exceptional. There are several nuances in the movie that portray on screen the struggles and pain going in the minds of the actors.The music is exceptional. I just wish we get to watch more movies like this. Truly worth the time and it will definitely have a deep impact on you.

reviews.review_title: All Bad Ratings On Here Are Spam And Fake! This is an INCREDIBLE film!
reviews.content: As an American who watches a lot of amazing Hindi films (thank goodness for subtitles), I find it absolutely appalling how Indians will go through the most ridiculous lengths to bring down a film (such as pretending to be a foreigner online and bash the film delusionally) due to: fanbase hatred (a fan of Actor X despises Actor Y so he will spam imdb, youtube, etc with bad ratings and trash talk Actor Y as if the fan gets paid to do so), political leanings, religion, and other nonsensical reasons.Anyway, this movie is based on the real lives of Mumbai's underground rappers and their rise from their heavily underprivleged background to underground sensations. The film is terrific in ALL aspects. The acting was wonderful (Ranveer Singh, Alia Bhatt and the supporting cast were OUTSTANDING), music (amazing rapping and lyricism in the rap songs, as well as the soundtrack), the cinematography was A+ and it really felt like I was in the Mumbai slum witnessing the characters' livelihoods. Direction was stellar as Zoya Akhtar proves yet again she is one of the best in the businesses. Emotionally it was VERY impactful and very raw and real throughout. Describing the film as inspiring would be a large understatement. It also has very strong feminist themes and values, and offers strong commentary on the life of Mumbai society's disenfranchised people and groups.The negative reviews you see here are by jobless clowns. Do some netizens in India have nothing better to do? Study? Work? Have a hobby? Jeez. Oh, and it is far better than 8 Mile, which it also has zero similarities with other than the rapping part (sorry, jobless spammers!)This film premiered at the Berline Film Festival, which is the world's largest film festival that showcases over 400 films and has over half a million people in attendance. And Gully Boy received a thunderous response and ovation and widespread love and acclaim. Art Director Cameron Bailey even tweeted that he had never witness such appreciation for a film in 20+ years there. It was by far the most talked about film at the festival. And for good reason! IT IS NOTHING SHORT OF AMAZING. Do yourself a huge favor and watch it, you won't see a film like this for a very long time.

reviews.review_title: Word Outstanding is less expressed for Gully Boy
reviews.content:
Finally saw Gully Boy. Outstanding direction, performance and cinematography. Every body part of Ranveer Singh expresses. He is of different league. Chemistry between Ranveer and Alia is so felicitous. Alia and Siddhant are brilliantly brilliant. Every character of the movie has played flawlessly. Nothing dramatic, nothing overly expressed.

Kudos to Zoya
Kudos to Ranveer
Kudos to Alia
Kudos to Siddhant
Kudos to Jay

The reason Gully Boy, despite its length, stays with the audience long after the credits have rolled, is that its goes beyond just the passage of grime to glory for the underdog. It's the devoted application of the sublime craft of every contributor to this film. Whether it is the writing of Zoya Akhtar and Reema Kagti (of the plot based loosely on the lives of street rappers Divine and Naezy) or the clutch of over twelve music directors who have contributed to the tracks and the score or the choreography, they weave their magic brilliantly. The cast too will surprise you with their acting chops- not just an understated Ranveer Singh or the fiesty yet vulnerable Alia, but Vijay Varma as Moeen, newbie Siddhant Chaturvedi as MC Sher, Amruta Subhash, who is only 6 years elder to Ranveer as his mother Razia and the ever dependable Vijay Raaz as his father and all the other cast and crew. They all deserve a standing ovation. What impresses is Gully Boy avoids falling into the trap of using anger and hate of the oppressed of the Dharavi underbelly espousing revenge as a motif for their struggles to rise. Rather, Murad aka Gully Boy, is a meek conformist, yet one who refuses to let the dream die within.
Director Zoya Akhtar has outdone herself with her deft essay; her dexterity in handling the soul of the poor with as much élan as the ways of the rich in her earlier outings. As the plot builds up to Gully Boy taking stage , Zoya quickly wraps up the open story ends as the credits begins to roll, superbly done so that you feel contented and complete even as the strains of "Apna Time Ayega" resonate with you and you too believe that their time indeed has come.

reviews.review_title: From Poor to rich, From Modernism to Post, From Bollywood to Hollywood!!!
reviews.content: So after all this examples, we could definitely argue that Bollywood movies are becoming, day-by-day, as Hollywood movies, portraying the struggle of Indians, and promoting the life of the slum. One of the most important scenes in the movie is where at the beginning of the movie we see a guide tourist with foreigners marching in the slum, taking pictures around, and giving them the opportunity to go inside one of the houses and check the living condition of the people who lives there. One house is way more than enough to generalize the whole living condition of all the population that lives in the slum. It only needs one scene to understand that each house in the slum is no different from the other.In fact, it is loosely based on the lives of Mumbai-based Muslim rappers. So when audiences, who like myself have a feeling at the end of the film wishing this very interesting/intelligent story is true, there is some pleasure present, which the other movie can never offer. But what "Gully boy" does go on to prove, which also could have been done in 2008, is that there are some clear signs of progress in India. In this movie, the audience will see a clearly (money-based)/cheaply-successfully growing community in Mumbai who are not involved in criminal activity, people who do live modern and social lives, and there is a sense of connection of the rest of the world. You see that Indians are now wearing (related to Europe) brands. Social clubs and bars have popped up. In fact, (even though there is the existence of) living in the crowded, dirty neighborhoods, Murad is aware of hip-hop culture and knows rap (words in a song) from classic songs.
Not so good ,copied seen, ranveer acting wasn't good, yaah but that new guy shidhant chatuvedi was brilliant he acts like rapper stole the show

reviews.review_title: Zoya Akhtar is the most boring director ever
reviews.content: I remember being forced to go to 'Luck By chance' and falling asleep midway and being woken up at the end and told that I hadn't missed anything.After watching ZNMD and Gully Boy, I have had the exact same experiences. Looks like she picks the most boring stories with an even more boring screenplay, and sprinkles an even more boring direction on top of it, completing the trifecta for a complete snoozefest.Just like even relying on the adrenaline of skydiving couldn't salvage ZNMD, the supposedly fiery nature of rap battles can't rescue this one. The rapping is pedestrian at best and the cringe nature of the lines within them as well as the rappers delivering them are pathetic enough to make you walk out of the theater midway.I'm glad I haven't watched Dil Dhadakne Do yet, and I have decided to spare myself the torture of another Zoya Akhtar movie for life. No thank you.

reviews.review_title: Ranveer Singh and Zoya Akhtar masterpiece
reviews.content: What a great movie to watch! Ranveer Singh has struck a golden and mindblowing performance again.. The plot keeps you engaged, songs are entertaining. While Ranveer steals the show, Alia and other supporting roles have also done their bit to put up a great show. Love the direction. The movie keeps you interested till the end. Amazing that it made it's way to Amazon Prime so fast.

The storyline is a bit used up demonstrating the rise of an underdog from the streets of Dharavi. But the execution is amazing and results in a truly mesmerizing experience. I am not a big music fan, but the movie had so much more than just music. The love story arc wasn't there just as a filler, the friendship arc felt real as anything, and the performances by not only the lead cast, but also from the actors portraying Sher and other friends are wonderfully done.

Had always felt Ranveer and Zoya were overrated but Gully boy proved me wrong, they are one of the best. Loved the movie. Zoya is truly a master of her craft. Gully boy is the coming of age story of an underdog Murad. There are loads of heartwarming scenes. Brilliant casting, every character has performed exceptionally, hats off to team gully boy.
